dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOZEN gorgeous, leggy GIRLS fight for the mirror. Miles skin. Heavy make-up. Lashes. Boobs. Butts. Fishnets. Boas. And SEQUINS. Oceans of them. It's definitely decadent. Completely cabaret.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come to think of it, none of them are all that good, which isn't all that bad... SEAN (31), a cute gay guy with an armful of accessories pushes his way through the girls and in a blur, tightens corset, tosses a boa, adjusts a garter just so.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Eight shows a week. Sixteen gorgeous girls. Thirty-two towers of luscious legs...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON TESS --
dialogues.text: Behind her, our GIRLS slink onto the stage one by one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Scarlett. Jesse. Anna. Coco-puff. And Georgie-Girl. The girls gather at the edge of the stage, lit by footlig moving in place to the beat of the INTRO MUSIC. Hips sway Fingers snap. Tess weaves playfully between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them the creme-de la creme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De la creme. The girls strike nasty, (but funny) provocative poses, et

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each one a bastion of bodacious... (Coco bends over, peers between her legs) Elegance. TWO GIRLS upside down on chairs NAIL aerial splits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention their other... (smacks Coco on the ass) Ass-ets. Coco raises a brow, moves her butt to a LOUD BUMP-AND-GRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Burlesque Lounge, dead smack in the center of the Sunset Strip-- did I say "strip?" (cat calls from audience) I meant TEASE... FOOTLIGHTS FLARE, UPLIGHTING THE GIRLS. They shift their weight, hitting the beats with risque moves and hip-thrus as they MOVE DOWNSTAGE suggestively toward the audience t the MUSIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, grime-streaked steel town, hanging on by the ski its teeth. Boarded-up storefronts, a run-down A&P. CA MOVES past an old sign: WELCOME TO GRUNDY!!! and lands on a broken neon sign that reads "DWIG 'S BAR" It flickers s you can read the name: DWIGHT'S. Then goes back to DWIG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chipped paint. Old beer posters. A few pathetic customers Beer on tap. Pinball standing lonely in the corner. A REGULAR drains his beer, tosses down a quarter and star to leave. Someone stops short at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, excuse me? You forgot something. He turns. Sees: ALI ROSE. One hand holding a bar rag, the other planted o her hip. Ali has a look that's all her own: short shorts, white platform sandals, hair piled up high, more make-up the rest of Grundy's women combined. She's young -- 22 -- but has a confidence that's got nothing to do with age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's your tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. See, now that's interesting -- you and I must do math completely differently, cause me? I start with the six beers I brought you, add the four spills I cleaned up, the five times I refilled your peanuts, plus the three times you "accidentally" touched my ass, then I tack on lying to your wife when she called looking for you, twice, and I come up with a sum that's a hell of a lot more than twenty-five cents. Before the Regular can respond, Ali is joined by LORETTA 30's wearing every one of those years hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just teasing, Ike. You go on home now, and tell Kay I said hi. The Regular leaves. Loretta picks up the quarter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin's cheap. A quarter's an insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll cover half a load down at the Spanky Clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing a quarter is good for. Ali takes the quarter and heads to the back of the room, passing a GEEZER who's sitting by himself, drinking alone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, hon, now you know how Dwight feels about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dwight isn't here. Ali stops in front of the rinky-dink karaoke machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could come back any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough. I'm not working here for the tips Loretta. She pops the quarter into the machine and chooses a song. She picks up the microphone and, after a few opening beat starts singing ETTA JAMES'S "SOMETHING'S GOT A HOLD ON ME

dialogues.speaker: FEELING, Y-E-A-H
dialogues.text: And now we see where the confidence comes from. She's got voice that's way too big for this town-- the kind that reaches way down inside you and rattles things loose. WE HEAR the same song continue as we INTERCUT with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girls undulate at the footlights as they sing the cho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali is belting now. Loretta is torn betw enjoying listening and watching the door for Dwight.

dialogues.speaker: NEVER, NEVER HAD BEFORE, NO, NO ...
dialogues.text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE the Girls belt out a raucous choru

dialogues.speaker: YEEEEEEEEAAAAAAAHHHHHH...
dialogues.text: As other ENTERTAINERS appear onstage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The insatiable La Puccini Triplets! Death-defying daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille! The Countess of contortion, Eva Destruction! And how about a little love for those bad boys of burlesque, our naughty- bawdy bumber band! THE TATTOOED BAND blares as the troupe kicks in unison
IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali sings, with a powerful vocal quality reminiscent of Etta James, Sarah Vaughn, Billy Holiday.

dialogues.speaker: THAT, OOOH ...
dialogues.text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE, the GIRLS and the BAND, loud and bawdy.

dialogues.speaker: OOOOOOOOOOOHHHHHHH
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali, letting loose now. Wailing.

dialogues.speaker: YEAH.
dialogues.text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE, the BURLESQUE GIRLS move in a lin toward the audience, confident, sexy. The BARTENDERS, WAITRESSES and people working at the club sing along.

dialogues.speaker: BA-DA, BA-DA, BA-DA
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali, letting it rip. The Geezer sips his beer, unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: SWEETER WHEN I TALK. I SAID, OH.
dialogues.text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE, The Girls.

dialogues.speaker: OOOOH.
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali.

dialogues.speaker: OOOH. HEY BABY, IT MUST BE LOVE
dialogues.text: ON THE BURLESQUE STAGE, The Girls form a line.

dialogues.speaker: YOU KNOW IT MUST BE LOVE.
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali sings.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, MAKE ME FEEL ALRIGHT
dialogues.text: IN THE BURLESQUE LOUNGE, The Girls, Tess, the other Entertainers, Busboys, Waitresses, Bartenders and entire company do a BIG FINISH.

dialogues.speaker: BA-DA, BA-DA, BA-DA, BA-DA
dialogues.text: IN DWIGHT'S BAR, Ali finishes the song. Loretta CLAPS. Th Geezer, unimpressed, gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People around here wouldn't know talent if it bit 'em in the Danglies. Where you gotta go is Des Moines. They got karaoke bars where you can win a hundred bucks a night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta-- when I get out of this butt-hole of a town, I sure as shit won't be heading for Des Moines. She hops up onto the bar, spins around on her butt, one l up in the air like a Varga girl, then hops down on the ot side then gets back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience is still applauding as the Performers crowd the backstage area, squeezing past the Puccini Triplets preparing their act. Tess comes off stage and bumrushes Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rehab, if there's a God. The BACKSTAGE DOOR BURSTS OPEN revealing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard that. Nikki, a stunning, feisty brunette, sashays in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Nikki, you're later than Georgia's period! Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weave, wax, paws and claws. She drops her bag, quickly peels her clothes off, holds o her arms as Sean slips her corset onto her-- Tess eyes Nikki's body--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there. Weigh in. Nikki unwillingly steps on the scale. Tess shakes her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put on five pounds or I bump you. Nikki protests as Sean double-takes at Georgia -- who FLI BY with a slightly protruding belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali winds her way through the trailers, carrying a bag of take-out, with a swing in her step -- moving to music pla in her head. She reaches a double-wide, lets herself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanna? Got your pot roast here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV noise. She comes in, kicks off her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were out of steak fries, so I got you some of those... Then she stops in her tracks. Nanna -- 80's, housecoat, oxygen tank -- is slumped in her chair. The TV remote is the floor. "ENTERTAINMENT TONIGHT" is blaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loretta and Ali, at the grave with a MINISTER who looks t about 17. A CEMETERY WORKER is nearby, picking his teeth with a toothpick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Lord, we gather here today not to mourn, but to celebrate the life of Alison Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arlene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Arlene. I'm Alison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. (then, befuddled) Can I start over? Ali rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LATER,
dialogues.text: The Minister and the Cemetery worker walk away, leaving A and Loretta alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were real good to her, Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she was good to me. She rearranges the flowers resting on the plot, fixing it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she wasn't even my real Nanna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foster care. She took me in for the checks. When I turned eighteen, the money stopped coming. She could've kicked me out, but she didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a lot of pain at the end. Nothing she talked about, but I could tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I guess this is a blessing. Now she's free. ON ALI, thinking realizing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking about herself) Yeah. I guess she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanna's clothes - mostly flowered housedresses -- are fol in paper bags. Her belongings are stacked up in the corne CLOSE ON ALI'S MATTRESS, as she pulls a WAD OF CASH out f under it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki leads a GROUP OF GIRLS in a raucous routine to "HON ROCK". Very Moulin Rouge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the wings, Tess watches with Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls look good tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing what a pink spotlight can do. Hides more cellulite than a burka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE IN ON ALI, as she counts the money. Shit. Not enough Then she looks around the trailer and realizes - tough sh Stuffs the money in a pocket, then pulls out a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burlesque Girls tease the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SUITCASE, as Ali throws in her belongings. When it's full, she grabs a stack of records -- Jazz and Soul -- tr to fit them into the suitcase, but it won't close. She pi one: ETTA JAMES. She sticks it in the suitcase and zips i up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali reaches into a drawer, pulls out a FRAMED PHOTO of A YOUNG WOMAN, 20's, short dress, heavy make-up, holding ha with a 7-year-old girl. Ali slips it into the suitcase pocket. She takes one last look around the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON ALI'S WHITE PLATFORMS, strutting down the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters. DWIGHT is at the bar: 50's, beer gut, humorle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're three days late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a death in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what, people stop drinking cause your grandma died? Get your apron and get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here to work. I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came for my back pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payday's the end of the month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I won't be here then. And you owe me for three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't owe anyone anything till the end of the month. Ali sets down her suitcase and marches over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, Dwight? Contrary to what you've been told, there's no law in Grundy that says you have to spend every waking minute being a tight-fisted, cheap-ass prick --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to intercede) Ooh, hon, I'm not sure that particular approach is gonna --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've spent three years of my life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And you'll probably spend another three. You want to quit? Good riddance. I'll replace you before you hit the county line, but I sure ain't gonna pay for the privilege. He walks out the back door, slamming it behind him.
ANGLE ON: THE CASH REGISTER. Ali opens the drawer, pulls a wad of cash. Peering out back to make sure Dwight isn't coming in, Ali counts out some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only taking what he owes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much was that bike you been wanting for little Keith? Ali STUFFS a few TWENTIES into Loretta's apron-- pockets rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali-- where are you gonna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somewhere I can breathe. Now gimme a hug, I gotta get out of here before he gets back. Loretta hugs her tight, then looks Ali in the eye, concer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just head off into the sunset without a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me. Ali gives her one more hug, then grabs her bag and leaves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali takes off down the street. She passes TWO OLDER WOMEN waiting for a bus. A beat as they watch her pass. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back. As Ali heads off, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali is at the ticket counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much to Los Angeles?

dialogues.speaker: TICKET BOOTH GUY
dialogues.text: One way or round-trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabaret chairs as they DROP FROM THE CEILING. The girls CATCH them, SPIN them around, SLAM them down and LAND ON IN VARIOUS LAYOUTS. IN THE WINGS, Tess hands Sean her corset as she slips int slinky dress. He takes her cigarette holder and grips it between his teeth as he zips her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're loving you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're loving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shucks, I just tell myself I'm writing for a big old drag queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat me. As he heads off with her discarded costume:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big old foul-mouthed drag queen! Tess looks in a mirror. As she makes the necessary adjustments, VINCE SCALI appears. 35, scruffy-handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good show tonight. She glances up, sees him. Gets icy. Goes back to primping

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad the club's half-empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got another call from Marcus Gerber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you told him we weren't selling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to raise his offer. I told him we'd hear him out. Tess spins around, looking him in the eye for the first t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, I don't care what the number is; the only way Marcus Gerber will get this club from me is by prying it out of my cold, dead, heavily- jeweled fingers. She pivots away and sweeps into the club.

dialogues.speaker: OH, HONEY
dialogues.text: Big finish, the number on stage ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali's on the bus, in a seat by herself. A LITTLE GIRL in front of her is peering over the chair, watching Ali. Ali smiles at her. The Little Girl's mother notices, gets the girl to sit down by tickling her. Ali unzips the pocket on her suitcase, takes out the FRAM PHOTO of the mom and girl, looks at it. Then she looks ou the window and watches America fly by as DAY TURNS TO NIG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over which we HEAR someone channel surfing radio static--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali sits with her radio headset, searching stations as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102.7 KIIS FM. Broadcasting from Hollywood and Vine... Ali perks up-- looks out the window as the bus rounds a b and... THE HOLLYWOOD SIGN comes into view. NEW MUSIC UP:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rush of tourists and traffic. Through a sea of people moving down the crowded sidewalk we FIND ALI as she emerg through the crowd, carrying her bags. Looking around at t exciting city. She SPOTS a SHITTY HOTEL with a sign: "$49 a night." She looks up at it. Then heads across the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cramped, dingy carpet, chipped paint. Key in the door. Th MIDDLE-EASTERN HOTEL MANAGER -- 40's -- leads Ali in, pointing out the features of the room, speaking fast in a impossibly thick Kurdish accent. Ali nods along, not understanding a word. When he stops:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Good luck with that. He drops her suitcase on the bed and stands there. Waitin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hang on. She digs into her purse. All she has is twenties. She pee one off and holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I could just get a little -- But before she can finish, he pockets it, nods and leaves closing the door behind him. To the closed door:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- change. She pulls open the blinds, they fall off the wall with a CRASH! Ali stares at them. Then she opens the window. The SOUNDS OF HOLLYWOOD pour in. She digs out her cash, sticks it under the mattress. Then she reconsiders.

She removes the money, takes a Ziploc bag full of make-up from her purse, dumps the make-up onto the bed, seals the money up in the Ziploc, and takes it into: THE BATHROOM. She lifts the lid of the back toilet tank a slips the Ziploc of cash under it, catching the bag in th lid as she sets it back down, so it won't fall in. She goes back into the main room to find a CALICO CAT sit on the window sill. It MEOWS, hops into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I thought this was a single. The cat curls up next to her. She checks his junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical. First guy I meet is neutered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't happen to know anyone in the music business, do you?

dialogues.speaker: "BACKSTAGE WEST" MAGAZINE,
dialogues.text: Ali sips coffee from a paper cup as she reads TRADES and ADS spread over the floor. She refills the lid of the cup which the cat laps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singer/Actress... Singer/Songwriter .Singer/Scuba diver? Perfect. ON ANOTHER AD: It says: "SINGER/WAITRESS WANTED." MUSIC U

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali cruises toward the address, dressed in her Iowa best, full of confidence. She rounds a corner and sees: A LONG LINE OF 165 GORGEOUS, IMPECCABLY GROOMED GIRLS. Ali stops in her tracks. Tougher competition than she was expecting. She heads for the back of the line, passing gi doing vocal warm-ups. One girl is belting out a riveting "SOMEWHERE OVER THE RAINBOW". Just as Ali gets in line, t door opens and a SKINNY GUY sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, ladies, that's all the applications we're taking today. CLOSE ON: an ad: "DANCERS WANTED. PRETTY GIRLS ONLY."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali circles the ad, sips coffee. Looks at the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali breezes in-- SEES ...a bunch of stripper poles, seedy drunk guys in the audience. She PIVOTS, and walks right b out. As she leaves, a DRUNK GUY turns to A SEEDY GUY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters, full of energy, as 65 hot LATINA and AFRICAN- AMERICAN girls in butt-baring, hootchie, hip-hop garb, tu in unison and eye her, in her denim shorts and white platforms. Not her crowd. CLOSE ON: A PEN CIRCLES: "SINGER/DANCERS WANTED FOR TOUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, eyeing the ad, sips a cup of coffee. Looks at the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, dressed like the girls at the video audition: hootch street -- opens the door to find 30 CLASSICAL BUN-TOPPED BALLERINAS stretching, warming up. A Degas painting. They turn in unison and eye her. Again, not her crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gleaming in the California sunshine. Ali stares up at the glittering shrine to recording. Takes in the whole swirli crazy scene around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali wanders down the sidewalk chugging an iced latte. The Strip hums with SLICK NIGHT LIFE. Expensive cars pull up valets. Hipsters swish past velvet ropes. Ali moves throu the throngs, alone, anonymous, invisible. She passes a CONSTRUCTION SITE for a 15-STORY-TALL BUILDI all lit up, guys working at night. A BUS pulls out, spewi exhaust. As the smoke clears, Ali sees, across the street A BEAUTIFUL, STATUESQUE GIRL standing on the landing of a fire escape under a street lamp beside a NONDESCRIPT CLUB Ali catches glimpses of her as the Sunset traffic whizzes full make-up, spangled burlesque costume, impossibly high heels, awesome. This is Coco. Coco makes the dirty streetlight look like a movie-quality Kleig. Everything a her shimmers. Intrigued, Ali looks for a break in the traffic and cross the street. As she nears the club, she hears a MAN'S VOIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said, LOOK BUT DON'T TOUCH! ALEXIS, drag queen/door whore, also in full costume and m up, TOSSES a GUY out the front door onto the street, then heads back inside-- Ali smiles to herself. Then turns back to look at COCO wh disappears inside a BACK DOOR as...NIKKI walks out. Light ciggie. She has on full make-up. Lacquered lips. Lashes l peacock feathers. She sees Ali staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't your Mama tell you it's not polite to stare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you're just -- so DAMN beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, screw your Mama, stare away. Nikki strikes a pose, campy, showing Ali her best side. T both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one would ever guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're a dude. Nikki's face turns to stone. Her eyes widen in horror. Al sees the mistake she made. She's mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Shit's" right, you little half-wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki is about to unleash when the stage door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch! You're on! Sean grabs her and drags her inside. As he does, a STRAND CRYSTAL BEADS comes off her costume, falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sor-- The stage door slams shut. Ali picks up the strand of bea Holds them up in the light, watching them shimmer. She goes to the front of club, where a smattering of L.A. HIPSTERS enter. There's a GLASS DISPLAY CASE full of phot of the acts. Ali looks at the pictures of the Girls in th elaborate costumes and provocative poses. She's unintentionally made her way to the front door. Bla curtains obscure her view inside. She peers in. HEARS coo music emanating. The sounds of a nightclub. Intriguing. S ventures inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali MOVES down a DIMLY LIT HALLWAY. More beautiful photos women in elaborate costumes, drawings, sketches, painting clutter the walls. Ali follows the photos down the hallwa MUFFLED SOUNDS penetrate the darkness: people talking ove each other, glasses clinking. 1930's Berlin style music.

dialogues.speaker: I.D.
dialogues.text: Alexis sits on a stool, glaring down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? A strip club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip club? Honey, I ought to wash your mouth out with Jaegermeister. The only pole you'll find in here is Natasha the shot girl. Ali looks back at the photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babycakes, shit or get off the throne, I got a club to fill here. Ali digs her ID out, hands it over. Alexis scans it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks. Ali looks in her wallet. Sees one lone twenty inside. She hands it to Alexis. He nods for her to go ahead. Ali descends a staircase INTO THE CLUB... .and is BOMBARDED by: colors, chaos, laughter, scandal -- all shimmering, as if someone dunked the place in glitter And over it all, an incredible mash-up of old music with contemporary beat tying it all together. Ali ENTERS, rounds a pillar, staring out into the room as SPOTLIGHT finds the stage where half a dozen OSTRICH FANS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoother than honey and twice as sweet. Each girl lovelier then the next. Gentlemen, hold onto your hats. Ladies, hold on to your gentlemen. We may not have windows.. .but we DO have the best view on the Sunset Strip! MUSIC KICKS IN AS LIGHTS FLARE from the back of the stage where Three Girls stand, backs to the audience, Fosse-sty Coco, Georgia, and Nikki strut downstage. Behind them, Gi MOVE AND DANCE on cabaret chairs. Totally raunchy, comple timeless.

The girls hit the beats, turning upside-down on cabaret chairs, arched backs, legs reaching upward, bending over, asses to the audience, bodies writhing in air-tight choreography: thrusting hips, whipping heads, stomping fe Ali watches, exhilarated, as the music builds and SWELLS full on performance with the entire ensemble--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get you a drink? She turns. A bartender is watching her watch. JACK - 25, punky, dark hair, eyeliner, one arm half-sleeved with tat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you're buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slides her a beer) Welcome to L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that obvious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have that new-car smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not brand new. But still under warranty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from? She looks back at the stage, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iowa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Kentucky. We're practically related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you looked familiar. He smiles. As Ali sips her free beer, Jack stacks drinks tray for a DITSY WAITRESS. He slides the tray to her. She doesn't notice. He barks at her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey_. Go.
The Waitress picks up the tray -- almost spilling the dri - then heads off. Ali looks around the place-- wowed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't build 'em like this in Iowa, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no. I wouldn't have left. She stares up at the stage, marvels at the dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me -- who does a girl flirt with to get from here... (points to the stage) to there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this you flirting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With someone wearing more eyeliner than me? He laughs. Points across the club to A DOOR leading backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask for Tess. She's your guy. Flirt away. As she heads off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Iowa-- use my name. He hands her a card. She looks at it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack. She smiles, slips it in her cleavage and heads for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters into a frenzy. Legs, costumes, boobs, heels, eyeliners -- all flying around like a flock of birds.
In the middle of the maelstrom sits Tess, at a mirror, quietly applying lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I'm looking for Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glued to the mirror) So am I. And sometimes, when the lights are dim, and I squint my eyes ...I can still see her. She switches to mascara. Sean, arms heavy with corsets, catches eyes with Ali, nods toward Tess: "that's her." Al steps closer to Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm a friend of Jack's, and I'm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and I'm--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to perform here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Tess glances at Ali in the mirror. Then goes back to her mascara, unimpressed. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a singer. A good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a dance show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a quick glance) Really? You a professional?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a quick study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on my dime. Tess stands, a final check in the mirror. Ali sees her ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I get that you're busy so I won't waste any more of your time-- but this place-- I've just never seen anything like it before and I know I belong here. So, how can I be a part of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks at the door can make all your dreams come true. Tess strides out, not looking back. Ali sees the Girls trading glances, amused. She turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bumper Band plays as Ali makes her way back toward th bar, dejected. Across the room, the Ditzy Waitress, holdi an empty tray, flirts with a table of YOUNG HIPSTER GUYS. Ali sees ANOTHER TABLE OF CHIC CLUBSTERS trying to get th waitress's attention. The Waitress ignores them. Ali sees the trays on the end of the bar. She grabs one, to the TABLE OF CLUBSTERS, clears their empties, takes th order. She finds Jack at the bar, unloads the empties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One Dewar's neat, one shot of Patron, and get this, tough-guy in the hat? He wants a Cosmo. Jack looks at her, surprised. Impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night. If I'm not 20 times better than boobs-for-brains over there, you don't have to pay me.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALI'S WHITE PLATFORM SANDALS,
dialogues.text: weaving their way through the tables. WIDEN to see she no wears a Burlesque Lounge Cocktail Waitress get-up. She delivers a heavy tray to a table. She heads back to the bar with empties, eyes glued to the stage, where Coco and the GIRLS are dancing to "Wagon Whe Watusi." As Ali hits the bar, Coco nails a stunning kick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her leg went behind her head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Coco's the real deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used to dance with the Joffrey Ballet. Nikki sang opera. Eva performed with Cirque. Everyone here's a pro. (slides a tray of drinks) And you're on!

dialogues.speaker: BACKSTAGE,
dialogues.text: Nikki, lined up with the other girls, peers between the curtains, spots Ali serving the drinks to a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that bitch out. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd she do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thought I was a drag queen! Stifled giggles from the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be the first time THAT'S happened. Nikki is about to haul off on Sean when the CURTAIN OPENS and WHOOMP!

she turns, flashing her best stage smile as she joins Coc and the Girls onstage in the sexy, high-energy Fosse-styl "Wagon Wheel Watusi." From the floor, Ali serves drinks, takes care of customer all the while watching the spectacle on stage, mesmerized

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Ali enters, exhausted, but on Cloud 9, singing "TOUGH LOVER" to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he kisses me I get a thrill... The Cat MEOWS and slinks out from behind the bed. Ali pul the crystal beads out of her pocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when he does that wiggle I can't keep still (ties the beads around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause he's a tough lover.. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Prince Nez" by Squirell Nut Zippers plays as Eva Destruction, dressed as a naughty-sexy ballerina, does a bawdy -- and technically flawless -- ballet number on a cabaret chair, on pointe. ON THE FLOOR, Ali delivers a tray of drinks to a table of MUSIC-INDUSTRY GUYS. One of them drops a bill on her tray

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She heads back to the bar. As Jack loads her tray up, she stuffs her tips into her pocket-- SEES Sean, looking her and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, girl, time for Sean to give you a real tip. He ties her shirt up higher, undoes the top few buttons..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got lips that could suck the chrome off a Peterbilt, but that matte is about as sexy as a bedpan.
As Sean wipes off Ali's lipstick, then whips out a tube o lip gloss and paints away, Jack and Ali share a smirk. Se steps back, assesses his work. Pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now baby, go show 'em what you got. He heads off. While Eva performs onstage, Ali delivers th drinks to a table of SCENESTERS as Eva winds up her act i flurry of fierce ballet moves, finishing to APPLAUSE as.. Ali notices someone waving her over. MARCUS GERBER. 31, boyishly handsome in jeans and a ringer tee. Gold Rolex, status sneakers. Charming. Charismatic. When Ali gets to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewar's on the rocks for me. Bottle of Dom for the table and-- (tosses a black AmEx on her tray, noticing her) --And tell Nikki I'm here. Ali starts away, then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods toward the card) A member since 1991. Oh-kay. He smiles, wickedly handsome. Ali pivots and head back to the bar. Before she can tell Jack the order:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dewar's rocks, bottle of Dom, keep it coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Asshole's a regular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus Gerber. Real estate guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This week. Vince goes over to Marcus's table, shakes hands, joins hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technically your boss: Vince Scali. Tess's partner. And ex... Jack is about to lift the AmEx off the tray, when Sean sw by and intercepts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black AmEx! The backstage pass to life! He sees Coco walking by, swipes the AmEx in her cleavage. She shudders, then turns around and tips her ass up at hi He swipes the card again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Access denied!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a first! Jack sees Ali laughing at their banter. She heads off wit the tray of Dewar's and Dom as the "Prince Nez" number en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS UP on TESS, CENTER STAGE as she begins a new numbe "Long John Blues." A singing/spoken hilarious interlude. Girls back her up.

dialogues.speaker: IT'S JUST YOUR CAVITY, NEEDS A LITTLE FILLIN'.. .
dialogues.text: As she continues... ON THE FLOOR, Nikki is sitting in Marcus's lap, nibbling neck. Vince sits down beside Marcus. Marcus pats Nikki on butt, excusing her. As she heads off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the verge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no choice. We owe a balloon payment of 100 grand on the first, she took out a second to buy me out of the condo. And she just got turned down for another loan today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a handful of these clubs around town, I could buy one of them tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wouldn't be in the heart of the Sunset Strip. ON STAGE TESS AND THE GIRLS TOYING WITH THE AUDIENCE...

dialogues.speaker: AGAIN, AND AGAIN, AND AGAIN AND AGAIN
dialogues.text: A RIM-SHOT and BLAST from the band as the audience laughs From the stage, Tess notices Vince shake Marcus's hand an leave. A flicker of irritation-- nothing anyone in the audience would notice -- but it's there.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR,
dialogues.text: Ali brings a tray of empties over. Sean is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. My lines. Our secret. Jack gives Sean his drink. He walks off. MUSIC UP: An insanely cool version of Sly and Family Stone "Everybody Star" mashed up with a Fosse-esque Burlesque rap.
Jack notices Ali watching the stage... she lights up and melts, enraptured by the girls as they vamp to choreograp in a tight group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Song CONTINUES over a SERIES OF SHOTS: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali plops down a bunch of BOOKS, OPE The Golden Age of Burlesque", lays on her bed, petting he cat with her foot. She locks in on a photo of 20's-era Burlesque dancers over which we HEAR--

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY IS A STAR ...
dialogues.text: IN THE CLUB, BURLESQUE GIRLS strike a similar pose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

dialogues.speaker: ALI CHANNELING THE CHOREOGRAPHY AS SHE
dialogues.text: - wipes down tables with Jack in the club after hours, - flips through old Soul records at a used LP store, - pokes her way through the scruffy street folks that han out by her hotel.

dialogues.speaker: BURLESQUE GIRLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ALI'S BED, Ali flips to a picture of Mae West IN THE CLUB, Tess cracks up the crowd

dialogues.speaker: BURLESQUE GIRLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali eats Chinese take-out as she por over the book. Turns the page to a photo of OLD SCHOOL ACROBATS over "Everybody Is A Star"... IN THE CLUB, Daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille nail an

dialogues.speaker: BURLESQUE GIRLS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)
IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali, in the bath, still reading, tur the page to a gorgeous image of Josephine Baker

dialogues.speaker: COME OUT ON A CLOUDY DAY ...
dialogues.text: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali vamps, dancing to the song in he room in a t-shirt and undies. The cat watches her, yawns and slinks away. IN THE CLUB, The Burlesque Girls thwack down on chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WHISPER RAP A'LA FOSSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN ALI'S HOTEL ROOM, Ali thwacks down on an old mustard- colored chair.

dialogues.speaker: STOPPING TIL IT'S IN THE GROUND...
dialogues.text: IN THE CLUB, AN OVERHEAD SHOT, THE BURLESQUE GIRLS now in different costumes in a BUSBY BERKELEY cluster, AS CAMERA BOOMS DOWN ON THEM and they separate to reveal: ALI, center stage, belting UP AT CAMERA:

dialogues.speaker: SLAM CUT TO --
dialogues.text: FIND Ali, in her waitress outfit, watching the girls on stage, lost in her fantasy. She catches herself, then mov along serving drinks while the Girls work the stage. The Burlesque Girls continue their Burlesque Rap. When th girls thrust out their hips in unison, Ali does too, unconsciously dancing along with them. AT THE BAR, Jack notices. Watches. Tries to focus on pour drinks, but his eyes keep drifting to Ali's hips. NEARBY, Sean notices Jack noticing. Looks from Jack to Al Eyebrow goes up. Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backstage mayhem. Girls scurry, Sean fusses, Tess sits at mirror, applying a fake eyelash as WE HEAR a surprisingly good woman's voice BELTING a SONG! It's Nikki. Late again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki, do you even own a watch? Or do you measure time in Patron shots? Ali enters with a tray of drinks. Nikki swipes one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no, that's for -- Nikki opens a bottle, pops 3 pills in her mouth, washes t down with the drink, and sets the empty glass on Ali's tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, I guess. Nikki turns to the mirror and starts getting to work. As hands out the other drinks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess? Do you have a second? Tess doesn't answer. But a slight glance at Ali in the mirror shows she's half-listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking -- see, I grew up listening to all this music, I'd play the records over and over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast-forward, babe. I gotta rebuild Rome in the next two minutes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now see-- that's what I've been thinking about. There's one thing I don't get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the vocals. You have the girls lip-synching. which is fine, I guess, but wouldn't it be so much better if they actually sang? The Girls trade looks, knowing Ali's overstepping here. A doesn't feel the vibe-shift, surges ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been reading up on it, and back when burlesque started, that's what they did. Silence. Nobody moves. All eyes on Tess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no she didn't? Tess slowly spins around in her chair to face Ali. Peers her with a supercilious gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "When burlesque started"? Which was...when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching her memory) Oh. Well... this book said it came after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaudeville -- is the word you're looking for. Derived from the 15th- century French expression "voix de ville" -- "voice of the city". Popular songs of the time that were strung together into stage shows. Which, over time, gave birth to another kind of show in which talented girls showing a bit more skin danced, did skits, and, _ yes, sang. In addition to being raunchier, these shows were funnier, hence the new name. "Burlesque": "comical" in French. Ali sees the Girls enjoying this dressing-down immensely. Tess stands, peers down her nose at Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance major. Juilliard. I did my thesis on Burlesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Ok. It's just-- It's just that ...I CAN sing and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can all sing. But they don't come to hear us sing. They come to see the best dancers in town backed by the greatest singers in history. (then, condescending) But tell you what: when you find someone with better pipes than Sarah Vaughn, Billie Holiday and Etta James-- you let me know. She sashays out leaving Ali standing there with what's le of her dignity and an empty cocktail tray. The Girls laun back into prepping for the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali pushes in, pissed off, and hears the sound of PUKING. She sees Georgia's BOOTS sticking out from under the stal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia? You okay in there? A FLUSH. The stall door opens. Georgia comes out shakily with mascara-smudged eyes, sweet as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why they call it morning sickness when it hits at every freakin hour of the day. She rinses her mouth out at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't many women who could dance the Charleston on a chair at - - what are you, three months? Georgia turns sideways to the mirror, inspecting her bump

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Can you believe my boyfriend hasn't noticed yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't told him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess as long as he doesn't know, I can still imagine he'll be happy about it. (looks in the mirror) Oh my God, look what the cat dragged in. She gets to work wiping away her smudged mascara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look pretty hot to me. Georgia reaches into her corset, yanks one breast skyward then does the same to the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well -- you take what Mother Nature gave you and milk the hell out of it, right? Coco enters carrying a glass of tonic for Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Coco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be on the floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to pee. Is that okay with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when you're blocking my mirror it's not. Ali sees she's in the way. As she steps aside:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re. the music) That's us. You okay, or are you gonna puke on me during the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make any promises. Coco drags her out, leaving Ali alone. Ali looks at herse in the mirror. Reaches into her shirt and does the boob-h that Georgia did. Looks again. Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali trudges up the stairs, tired. Suddenly, TWO YOUNG THU barrel down the stairs, past her, almost knocking her ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! They tear past her. She shakes her head, reaches her landing, heads down the hall toward her room, then sees: HER HOTEL ROOM DOOR, ajar. The lock broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No! She runs down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransacked. Ali rushes in, goes straight into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid is off the toilet tank. Her Ziploc of money is go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! God damn it!!! She looks out the window, SEES the ROBBERS running off, disappearing down the street. She kicks the trash can. It flies across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Damn it, damn it, damn it, damn it, damn it! She sees the cat watching her from behind the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lotta help you were. The cat creeps out, slinks around her legs. Ali plunks on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Then she sees, on the floor, the PHOTO she took from Nann She picks it up. The glass has cracked, tearing the pictu
She takes the picture out of the broken frame, smooths it -- then looks around her trashed room. Fighting despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW a motorcycle up the street. The DRIVER has a KEYBO on his back. He parks, gets off, takes off his helmet. It Jack. He heads for his apartment, but slows when he sees: ALI, sitting on his steps, her bags at her feet. Head low

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali? What's wrong? You okay? She tries to speak, but can't -- so she just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Cause, in my experience-- when you're on someone's doorstep surrounded by everything you own, there's usually a not-so-good story

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as she expected, as soon as she talks, she starts to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (halting, gaspy sobs) Came in -- busted the lock-- and stole all my MO-NEY-EY-EY-EY!!! She sobs--trying to talk, with high-pitched SQUEAKS only heard by birds. Jack winces, trying to follow--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more gaspy sobs) And there's no way I-- sleep there-- with-- like that-- the manager said- - not till Monday-- and I don't-- anyone else-- but then-- so I remembered I had...but it went straight to...so I... She reaches in her pocket, pulls out a card. It's Jack's he gave her in the club. It has his address on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I have no idea what you just said, but come on in here and we'll get it sorted out. She looks at him. Wiping her tears. He picks up the heavi of her bags and leads her to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny one-bedroom. Very "done." Floral sofa. Curtains that match the area rug. Candle groupings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat. I'll get us BOTH a drink. Here -- He hands her his phone. She looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- call whoever you want, long- distance, whatever--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you can. Go ahead. Her chin starts quivering all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.. .don't ...have anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No parents? (she shakes her head) Siblings? Aunts? Uncles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one! No one, okay? Do I have to spell it out for you? I am -- completely -- alone!
Jack susses out the situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you're not here to use my phone. She starts to cry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Wait. No, stop, stop, stop, it's okay, it's fine. You'll crash here. No problem. Just, please -- no more crying. She nods. He grabs a bottle of Tequila and a couple of glasses. Pours them a couple. They both take a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. She wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for one night, I swear. Just till it's light outside and I can figure out my next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deal. Then she opens her small bag and the cat strolls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, you didn't say anything about a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You don't like cats? It slinks around his leg. He shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate cats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you hate a cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy, I'll show you. The cat bolts into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it going? If that thing pees on my bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes outside. We just have to open a window. He's very independent. She opens the window. The cat scurries back in, leaps ont the ledge. Ali pets him. Looks at Jack, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a name for him yet. It purrs. Jack eyes it warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE LIVING ROOM, the lights are low. Ali's on the couc under covers, cat at her feet. INTERCUT WITH: THE BEDROOM. Jack at his keyboard, playing from sheet mus learning a song. When he pauses, from the living room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you play at the club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make more money bartending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in a band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was... Guitarist moved to Reno, Drummer went to med school, bassist is in rehab. I'm subbing around town till I regroup. This is for a punk fusion band -- their keyboardist is a flake, so they call me a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flaky punk-rock-fusion keyboardist? No way. He smiles. Continues playing. HIGH ANGLE, seeing both of them on either side of a wall. Her listening, him playing. After a few measures:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... He stops playing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you leave Kentucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you leave Iowa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I looked around and realized there wasn't one person whose life I wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. A beat. Then as he starts playing again:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jack? He stops again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'm really glad I'm not alone tonight. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.
He continues playing. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light rain on the window. CLOSE ON: THE CAT'S FACE, staring right into camera. REVERSE ON: Jack, waking up. As his eyes open, the Cat li him on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aauuuugggghh. He hurls the cat away and bolts out of bed, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack straggles in, wiping his mouth. The sofa's made up, blankets folded. Ali is making breakfast, her back to him He can't help but notice she's only wearing a tiny tank t and undies. She hears him clear his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black. Like my soul. She pours him a cup. Sees a picture of a BEAUTIFUL GIRL o his fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pretty. Your sister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fiancee. Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiancee? You're straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm straight. You thought I was gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, the...make-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A straight look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the floral couch...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie. As Ali realizes she's barely dressed in front of a straig guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should put on pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably. She bolts out to the living room, starts digging through bag, bent over. She's in the doorway, so from the kitchen all he can see is her cute little ass sticking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York. Doing a play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six more weeks. She can't find pants. She shifts, so now her ass is facin him directly. He tries not to look--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God, now I feel bad about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Now that you're straight and engaged, it feels weird that I came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you did, and it was fine. Aha! Pants. She pulls them out, starts putting them on. H looks out. Her foot is caught in the pants leg. As she ho around, trying to untangle it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or at least it will be as soon as you get dressed. She tumbles out of view, thumps against some furniture. She appears in the doorway, pants on, pulling on a sweate She slips her feet into her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrighty then-- I'll get outta your hair now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, where're you headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't worry about me. I've got a plan. (scoops up the cat) Come on, cat. She zips the cat into the bag he came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, let me at least spot you some cash. I'm a little strapped, but I could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm good, if you could just She nods at the door. He opens it for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. For everything. You are my knight in shining... eyeliner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the door) I'll see you at the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. She leaves. He closes the door behind her. Stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali looks at the rain. Then marches out into it, lugging stuff. Goes about 15 yards in one direction, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack watches her out the window as she marches 15 yards i another direction, then stops. Pondering. She sees a bus stop across the street. She crosses to it and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali peers down the street for the bus. Jack appears besid her, getting soaked in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this plan of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .was to sit here at the bus stop and come up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jack, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll figure it out, this is not

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pouring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only water for chrissakes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack-- you've done enough and-- In ONE MOVE he SCOOPS HER up as she lets out a WHOOOOP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack-- No! Stop it! He grabs her bags and carries her back across the street-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOOR KICKS OPEN-- they ENTER, Jack carrying Ali, drip wet.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE PUT ME DOWN--
dialogues.text: He sets her down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you have nowhere to go, I have a couch. You may as well stay here for a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really don't need to do that. I'll be fine --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be homeless. You always have this much trouble saying yes when someone is trying to help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never happened before. The Cat jumps up on the back of a chair, all wet, and SHA splattering them with wet cat smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaargh! As his PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a towel in the bathroom-- dry yourself and that damn cat off.
Ali collects the cat-- heads for the bathroom. Jack check his phone. Answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby, how's it going?... Really? That's awesome...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That...? Just this person from work What? No, she's just a friend, I'm helping her out. Nat, it's nothing. O.S. MUSIC UP: "BABY YOU'VE GOT WHAT IT TAKES" by Brook Denton and Dinah Washington over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A HEAVILY MADE-UP GIRL as she screams and drops of the shot in a flying split. Behind her, a ROW OF DANCE do the same. Typical, fantastic, old-school can-can. WIDEN to see Tess and Sean, on the floor, auditioning the The club is brightly lit, none of its evening aura. Scattered around the club are other HOPEFULS in groups, waiting for their turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack's motorcycle pulls up to the club, with Jack driving and Ali riding on back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Jack enter as the auditions are under way. As the set up the bar, Ali watches the stage, intrigued. MONTAGE: the dancers auditioning, in small groups. All shapes, sizes. Ali watching. Finally only a few are left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, front row, thank you very much. They walk off stage, dismissed. Tess turns to Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to all the great dancers in L.A?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're busy "Dancing with the Stars." (to the waiting dancers) Last group, please. HALF A DOZEN DANCERS move to the stage. Ali watches from behind the bar, thinking. Then, on her face, we see: an i forming. ON THE FLOOR, Tess and Sean check their clipboards, organizing for this next set. They look up and start in:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, ladies, and five, six, seven -- whoa. There, in the back row, is Ali, in her white platform sho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing? Coco and Georgia ENTER-- surprised to see Ali on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, I've been singing and dancing my whole life and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls here have years of training and experience. This stage is for serious and professional

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry, interrupting) Hey_. This is your club and you can be as rude as you want--but don't you dare tell me I'm not serious. Sean's eyebrows reach for the ceiling as Nikki enters, SE Ali on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not have been to a professional dance school, but I have a lot of talent and I came to this town to do something with it. And the only reason I've been putting up with all the bullshit "attitude" I get from you is cause I want to do it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life, I don't want to be someplace else. So you're gonna give me MY shot. Right here. Right now. Everyone in the club just stands there. Jaws dropped. Tes just looks at her, blinks, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One song. You don't like it, I'll quit and do us both a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your call, lady. I know every number in the show. Sean, eyes big as saucers, looks from Ali to Tess, then b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know every number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one do you wanna see? Tess looks at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, which one do you wanna see? Ali just stares at her. Calling her bluff, Tess yells up DAVE in the sound booth--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough Lover! Tess plops down in a booth-- crosses her arms indignantly ON STAGE, the music starts. Ali readies herself, starts t dance. Behind a beat to two. She's got the steps right, b it isn't clicking. She's thinking too hard. No personalit After a few measures, Tess has seen enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay then, next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. (to Dave in the booth) Start it again, please? As Dave resets the music. Ali regroups: takes her hair do and shakes it loose. Nikki ENTERS, SEES Ali on stage--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. On stage, Ali takes a beat; inhales, breathing in attitud Then she looks up at the booth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anytime. The MUSIC starts in again. And this time, Ali comes alive She may not have perfect technique or the best extension, she exudes an ambition and sexuality no one has seen from before. It's like she becomes a woman before our eyes. Sh misses a step or two, but who the hell cares? On the floor, Sean gapes, eyes popping. Tess is poker-fac Coco and Georgia's expressions turn from dubious to respectful. Nikki's eyes narrow. At the bar, Jack freezes, a huge rack of glasses in his a - unable to tear his eyes away.

As the SONG CLIMAXES, Ali finishes with an alluring toss her ass, then lands in a sexy layout on a chair, owning t stage. The music ends. A stunned silence. The only sound is Ali's heavy breathing. Then Georgia jumps up, APPLAUDING EFFUSIVELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are so you happy about, that's your replacement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but she's really good. Tess and Ali are in a stare down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want so badly to say something bitchy, but nothing's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a first. Tess sighs, not wanting to give Ali any props.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were off the whole second half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I was spot on the first half? Tess narrows her eyes at Ali. Then looks over at Nikki, C and Georgia. Georgia gives an effusive THUMBS UP-- then suddenly becomes overcome by nausea, covers her mouth and RUNS to the bathroom to puke-- Tess rolls her eyes, looks back at Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're gonna be such a pain in my ass. Ali tries hard not to beam--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have the job, or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not great. What you are is lucky. Because I need someone tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know all the routines. As Tess turns and leaves--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in those shoes that time forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theeeere's bitchy. Nikki watches Tess go-- turns and pours herself a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-- this totally sucks ass. Sean jumps up on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations. The last time someone showed Tess balls like that, she married him. (looks Ali over) You look like a checker at a Mal Wart in Wichita. Just tripled your salary. Get a new look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I happen to like the way I look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's a fascinating story. And then what happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backstage in five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the family. Ali jumps off the stage, runs to the bar, where Jack is s standing, slack-jawed. She throws her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the short notice, I quit! (plants a big kiss on him) But hey-- with my raise I'll be off your couch in a week. She squeezes him tight-- then heads backstage leaving him standing there, really turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean swings open A DOOR, revealing a room packed to the g with costumes: feathers, sequins, fishnets, corsets, jamm up against each other. Sean tosses her clothes in a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First number, second number, third number... She catches the clothes. He dumps shoes on top of them, holding them up as he tells her what they go with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the sequined bustier. With the shorts and garters. With the beaded number. And those -- (points to hers) I never want to see again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! And -- He hands her a prop GOLD MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For "Miss Otis Regrets". Just be sure you don't -- Ali pulls the trigger. BOOM -- GLITTER SPLATS all over Se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chic audience watches the Girls doing a swingin' sixt shimmy and shake number. CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the girls' faces as drums roll and their heads turn to each drumbeat The last face to turn is ALI'S. In FULL STAGE MAKE-UP, sh looks like a gorgeous classic burlesque dancer. The girls in 20's revealing bathing suits and stilettos, kick and d downstage in a line. Ali struggles a little to keep up A WAITER CROSSES FRAME and we WIPE TO: - ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, different costumes. Ali's dancing is improving. WAITRESS CROSSES FRAME and we WIPE

- ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, yet another set of costumes. Ali's as good as anyone else up there. AN AUDIENCE MEMBER crosses frame and we WIPE TO: - ANOTHER NIGHT. SAME MUSIC, another set of costumes. Ali knows the steps now, she's not thinking about them. She's all performance, vamping to the audience, selling like cr She NAILS a final layout on a chair, it's flawless. Tess and Sean are watching from the wings. They notice th extra whip in Ali's head, the bump in her grind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit it. You like her. It kills you, but you like her. Tess meets his eye, then walks away. The number ends. The girls rush offstage and peel their costumes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tits are up around my ears, my thong's about a mile up up ass, this corset is so tight, I haven't breathed since Tuesday and these lashes are thick enough to kick up a stiff wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fun being a girl, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She hands him the last bits of her costume. FOLLOW Ali as she heads to the dressing room. As she grab her T-shirt and jeans:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starving, who wants to go grab some pizza before the next show? A general chorus of "Yeah?" and "I'm in." FOLLOW Ali to the bathroom as she throws on her clothes a washes off her make-up, humming "Rich Man's Frug" to hers She heads back out to the dressing room to find: EVERYONE IS GONE. She looks around. Feels like an fool. She plunks down in a chair. Drops her bag on the floor. Looks at herself in the mirror.

She sees a picture of A CLASSIC BURLESQUE BEAUTY taped to mirror. Notices her eye make-up -- strong, thick eyeliner Ali picks up a brush, dips it in eyeliner, and tries to duplicate the look on her own eye. After a first try:

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your brush is for shit. She turns and sees Tess in the doorway. Tess comes over, takes Ali's brush. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this, the 99 cent store? She chucks it in the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make-up is like wine. The good stuff costs a fortune but is worth every penny. Where is everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the girls went out for pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you one of the girls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently not. Tess reads her like a book. Knows what went down. She tur to leave, then pauses at the door. Turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally. Their love's the kind you gotta earn. Ali meets her eyes in the mirror. Then Tess grabs a brush from her own station, tosses it to Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dip it in water first, or you'll never get a clean line. She leaves Ali alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters in boxers, kicks them off, opens the shower, freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali is just waking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stupid cat peed in the tub!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...? (sees the window closed) You closed the window, what do you expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cat pees in the house, and it's my_ fault?! Ali scoops the cat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awwww. Poor guy, you must have been desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn cat. And you used my towel again. (then, pointed) How's that apartment hunting coming? He GRABS the newspaper and tosses it in front of her-- sh glares at him, then glances at the paper--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand bucks for a studio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you really put a price on privacy? Freedom? Your own bathroom? With clean towels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jack-- I get it-- His cell phone rings. As he checks who's calling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie. (then, into phone:) Hey, baby, how are you? He heads into the bedroom, closes the door. Ali shakes he head, begins to peruse the classifieds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, in pajamas, is at the table, combing the classified apartment ads. The cat is beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guest studio, Hollywood, $900, with a yard, and -- oh. No pets. (to the cat) Screw them. She scans the ads some more. Finds a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh? Jack walks in. Looks like he's got something on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I found my new place. Where's Pomona?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Hell, turn left, it's three miles down on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. How's Beachwood Canyon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, if you have a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, you should get a car first. This is L.A. You don't exist without a car. Plus, you can't really afford a decent place yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna suck it up and let you stay here a little longer. Just throw in a little something for rent. She looks at him, curious. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the "God damn" cat? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't like the cat. And I don't like my towel being wet. I don't like the lack of privacy. But you're in a jam -- and I'm the kind of guy, if a friend's in trouble, I help. It's just who I am. ALI (SUSPICIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Natalie have to say? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, you know just... hi. She narrows her eyes at him. He concedes. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...her play got extended three more months, so since she has to pay rent there, she can't also keep up her part of the rent here. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-hah. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you could stick around and chip in, it would -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your ass? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- help. Ali looks down at his shoes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, will you look at that? The shoe, on the other foot! JACK OKAY --
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One minute I'm a freeloader with a God damn cat, the next, I'm the only thing standing between you and EVICTION -- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just -- yes or no? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the proposal, exactly? Jack looks at her-- realizes he's screwed. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom, with private bathroom access, for 600 a month, including utilities. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closet? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half . Ali picks up the paper, reads an ad. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, look! Hot tub! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. The closet, too. She weighs it. Makes him suffer. Then: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. ALI (MOCKING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm the kind of girl, if a friend's in trouble, I help. That's just who I am. We HEAR an AUDIENCE laugh O.S. as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small crowd outside.

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So I said to the sailor, I may not be as good as I once was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a transparent scrim, the Puccini Triplets perform sexy harem scene in silhouette, casting larger than life shadows-- Tess walks behind the scrim playfully, in and o of view. The Bumber Band plays off to the side. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can bet your sweet ass I'm better ONCE than I ever was... The crowd laughs. Tess points to a woman who isn't laughi TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
