dialogues.text: Drink up, sister! You're a tad behind. (to a waiter, re: woman) Be a dear and bring Mommy over there another scotch. The crowd chuckles as the Bumper Band kicks in and the ha scene evolves into a sexy tongue-in-cheek silhouetted dan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess comes off stage. Sean bustles up to her. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distributor's holding back the booze unless we cut him a check. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ply him with drinks, send Scarlett over to flirt, and try to finagle him down to a half. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's a third? He produces a check, all filled-out, for her to sign. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I told you lately that I love you? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any brothers?

He bustles off with the check. Scarlett, Coco and Nikki approach the stage wearing leather, strappy Gaultier cors with gloves and fishnets --post-modern Germanesque -- Nik is carrying a glass of tequila. Tess eyeballs her-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinking already? NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mommie. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I'm working on it. Nikki totters a little. Tess looks her over. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pulling you from this number. Go home, wring yourself out, and come back tomorrow. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't pull me-- Tess SPOTS Ali heading for the dressing room-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali! Take Nikki's spot. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAT?! That bitch can't dance my part! TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali-- get dressed NOW! Ali looks at Nikki-- who GLARES at her-- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, wait-- Tess-- that's always been Nikki's number. Tess looks at her-- she's really had it with these girls- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is MY club, and now it's your number. Ali looks between the two of them, Nikki glaring at her--
TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? You said you know the whole show. (CHALLENGING HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do anything, right? Tess just looks at Ali. Nikki stares at Tess, livid, then storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus ENTERS the club and joins Vince at a table. A LOUD DRUM ROLL. MUSIC UP. THE STAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and the other dancers hit the stage and start in on t vampy "TOUGH LOVER." AT THE BAR, Jack is busy mixing drinks. He glances at the stage, then DOUBLE-TAKES on Ali, looking crazy gorgeous. vamps forward with the girls, they rotate singing into th prop mic. JESSE (LIP-SYNCHING)

dialogues.speaker: WELL, I WANT A LOVER WHO MOVES ME
dialogues.text: SO_ COCO (LIP-SYNCHING)

dialogues.speaker: WHO SURE KNOWS HOW TO ROCK N ROLL--
dialogues.text: ALI (LIP-SYNCHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE, the sound guy, looks up as Nikki comes in. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess needs you. She said it was urgent. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave here now -- NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, but don't say I didn't warn you...
DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, okay -- He checks his sound board -- then bolts from the room. Ni watches him go LOOKS DOWN onto the STAGE as ALI STEPS to THE MIC-- ALI (LIP-SYNCHING)

dialogues.speaker: THRILL, AND WHEN HE DO THAT WIGGLE--
dialogues.text: Nikki reaches out and FLIPS A SWITCH. THE SOUND DROPS OUT. THE PLAYBACK STOPS. The girls freeze in awkward poses, unsure of what to do. MURMURS in the room as the audience looks around, confuse BACKSTAGE, Tess looks up at the sound booth, sees it's em Dave appears at her side. DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me? ON STAGE -- Ali looks at flustered Tess...the girls...the audience. Panic. On the floor, Nikki watches with satisfaction as she make her way over to Marcus. Enjoying the train wreck she caus Then -- in a flash, Ali turns to the audience, and SINGS a'capella from the TOP OF THE SONG. ALI

dialogues.speaker: OH--OH--OOOOOOOOOOH.
dialogues.text: She looks around. Silence. Mouths agape. Tess approaches THE WINGS-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a stage hand) Close the Goddman curtain! SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on... Ali starts to sing again, her version, slow, and sexy... ALI

Tess looks at Ali, you could knock her over with a feathe Sean looks at Tess. Scarlett looks at Coco. Jack stares a the stage. Everyone stunned by the sound coming out of th girl. And now the song really takes off! SUDDENLY, one of the BAND BOYS grabs his sax and plays. A jumps in, seamless, as the guys on Bass and Drums join in Ali picks up the choreography. The girls fall in with her ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: LOVER. UH-HA...
dialogues.text: Coco and Scarlett chime in on back-up. Hearing them, Jess and Anna join in as well. Ali takes off, holding nothing back. The girls feed off her confidence, and soon all of them are hitting the backs of their cabaret chairs, stomp their feet to the music. The girls singing back-up. In his seat, Marcus sits up a little straighter -- sudden paying more attention. Unable to take his eyes off Ali. The BAND plays along. The BARTENDERS accompany them with hand-claps. All except Jack, who's too spellbound to move ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: KEEP STILL ...
dialogues.text: ON THE FLOOR, Nikki watches, aghast, as the crowd engages like we've never seen them. ALI/GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH LOVER. YEAH-YEAH.
dialogues.text: BARTENDERS/GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH LOVER. UH-HA...
dialogues.text: The girls come alive, finally able to sing a song they've been faking for so long ALI

dialogues.speaker: AIN'T VOODOO IT'S JUST THAT TWIST.
dialogues.text: (MORE)
ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SUEDE SHOES.
dialogues.text: ALI/GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH LOVER. YEAH-YEAH.
dialogues.text: BARTENDERS/GIRLS

dialogues.speaker: TOUGH LOVER. UH-HA
dialogues.text: The room ERUPTS IN APPLAUSE, knowing they caught a once-i lifetime performance. Marcus stands, clapping, whistling. Ali basks in it, jubilant, rapturous. She glances to the wings and sees Sean, clapping and jumping in place. Then sees Tess beside him, stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girls exit the stage in a flurry, everyone congratula Ali -- a whirlwind of hugs, kisses. Ali reaches Tess. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, when the music stopped-- TESS DAVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me you I have no idea what happened. could blow like that? ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Tess spots a TATTOOED BAND GUY in the door. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you boys know all the music?

dialogues.speaker: TATTOOED BAND GUY
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. Nikki wanders in, drink in hand. Tess looks at them all. Plants her hands on her hips.
TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. Tomorrow night, Ali sings lead, everyone else is back- up. Questions? Ali can't keep from beaming as she shakes her head, no! TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. The Girls file into the dressing room. Tess heads out, pa Nikki. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "People don't come to hear us sing." TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But they'll come to hear her sing. Dry out and maybe you can back her up. She leaves. Nikki scowls. Sean grabs Ali. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch, you SANG that damn song! He heads off to the dressing room, too, leaving Nikki and alone together. Their eyes meet. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us has clearly underestimated the other. She tosses her glass in the trash and leaves Ali alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali trots out from backstage, spots Jack behind the bar. heads over to him. Before she gets there: MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you learn to sing like that? She turns. Marcus is there. Handsome, charming and deviou ever. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't learn to sing like that.
MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're too good to be singing here. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got into the show and suddenly I'm too good for it? Shrugs, "but, you are" then-- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a drink? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Jack's at the bar. Tell him I sent you. It's on me. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I hate lines. AT THE BAR - Jack looks up, SEES Ali and Marcus talking. BACK ON MARCUS who looks Ali up and down. MARCUS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously. You sound even better than you look. Which is saying a lot. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about a "line." She smiles, amused, and heads away from him, toward the b He watches her go. Tess intercepts Ali. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he want? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directions to the bar. As Ali heads off. Tess glances back at Marcus, mistrustfu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After hours. The club is closed. Jack, Ali, Coco, Sean an Georgia are sitting around the bar as Jack closes up. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blew me away! Who knew you could sing like that?
COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knew any white chick could sing like that? You channeled that shit. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you do that, girl? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I can't explain it. It's like -- I start singing, and something starts to move inside me. It's in my hands, my feet, my gut, MY THIGHS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her hands over her body as she describes it. Jac watches her -- holy smokes. Sean notices his gaze on her. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and it just builds and builds till I feel like I'm gonna explode. GEORGIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I know what that feels like. I have to pee. Again. She hops off the stool and scurries to the back. Coco stands, to leave. Looks at Ali. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna grab something to eat? Ali looks back at Coco -- validated. Accepted. At last. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lemme get my bag. Ali moves off. Coco goes to get her coat. Sean sees Jack still watching Ali as she walks across the room. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, will you look at that. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking at that girl the way I looked at you all those years. Only difference: you actually stand a chance with her. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a fiancee.
SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three thousand miles away. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talk every day. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess what about: her, her and...oh! Her. Jack shoots him a glare. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, this one's beautiful on the inside too. And she won't be on the shelf forever. Ali comes back, ready to go. Feels them stop talking and look at her. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just explaining to Jack that even opportunity has a shelf life. Jack grabs a trash bag and takes it out back. Sean looks Ali more closely. He brushes her hair out of her face. Th he holds it off her shoulders and raises that gay eyebrow - INT. SALON - DAY - Ali sits in front of a mirror while gives the HAIRDRESSER very specific instructions. - INT. JACK'S APARTMENT, AT HIS KEYBOARD, Jack plays a hi energy style piano which runs over a QUICK SEQUENCE: It's instrumental music to: "BUT I'M A GOOD GIRL." - INT. BURLESQUE LOUNGE - The Burlesque Girls dance on st performing a high-energy tap dance, coupled with a Europe slap-dance, with the slapping of each other's bodies and faces integrated with tapping and music. It's very cabare but modernized with contemporary STEPPING. CARRY MUSIC: - INT. SALON - LATER - The HAIRDRESSER spins the chair around. Ali's her hair is platinum blonde, with bangs and Louise Brooks bob that frames her face beautifully. Her smoky eyes pop like never before. Ali studies herself: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have I been all my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDIENCE, the brass section kicks in giving the piano a BIGGER, BAWDY, SHOW-STOPPING BOISTEROUS SOUND as Ali APPE with her new look. Amazing. Like Helmut Newton meets Carn St. circa 1965. As she begins this HIGH ENERGY SONG-- Jac looks up from the bar. Totally blown away. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Ali finishes the song to big applause. Takes her bow. Mak her way off the stage and ACROSS the club to... JACK AT THE BAR - he turns to see Ali. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, big boy. She spins herself around on a bar stool, so he can see al angles. Jack likes plenty. Way too much. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? JACK (FLUSTERED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...I think-you look...I mean, yeah... do you like it? Not the reaction she was looking for. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. It's okay for you to think I look hot. We're friends for chrissakes. It's not like we're brother and sister.
She rolls her eyes, gets up, and heads backstage. Jack watches her go-- JACK (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We certainly are not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burlesque Girls are prepping for the show. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell is everyone having a conniption over her? She's just a tacky, pushy girl from a -- Ali -- sexy, sophisticated, gorgeous -- enters. NIKKI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fly-over state. Ali pretends she didn't hear. She sits at her mirror. The girls stare at her, mouths agape. Ali picks up her mascar wand, looks down the mirror at Nikki's reflection. ALI (FAUX INNOCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a fly-over state? Ali takes a deft stroke of her wand over her lashes, then bats them at Nikki. Nikki walks out. Coco smiles with appreciation. Whistles long and low. The girls all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess glad-hands guests, then spots Vince, waving at her. starts over, then sees Marcus in the booth with Vince. Sh turns and walks the other way. Vince catches up to her. VINCE TESS -- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, if I were going to sell, I'd have sold to those idiots building that monstrosity across the street. I said no.
VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which made Marcus bump his offer up again. It's obscene, what he wants to give us. At least hear him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, at her desk, reads a contract. Marcus and Vince sit across from her, watching. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very simple. I buy you out and pay you a million off the top. (motions to Vince) Five hundred grand each. Tess looks up from the contract, squints at Marcus. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you want this club so badly? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best view on the Sunset Strip. VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you could do with that money, Tess? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what you can do with that money, Vince? VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be reasonable. We're rolling vendors ninety days out. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club's not even worth what you paid for it. You've got a second mortgage, you can't get a third. Tess looks at Vince, betrayed. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you also tell him about the tattoo on my ass? VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's business, Tess. Not personal.
TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My business. Which I built from the ground up. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna get another opportunity like this. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. She looks at a photo on her wall: the Burlesque Girls, in their glory. TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why I'll never let it go. She gets up, opens the door, ushering them out. Marcus shoots Vince an angry look as they head downstairs. IN THE STAIRWELL, Vince reassures Marcus: VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. The balloon payment's due on the first. She doesn't have the money. She has to sell. IN TESS'S OFFICE, Tess stands in the doorway, having hear Then she walks back to her desk and sits, dejected. Head her hands. For the first time ever, looking worried and defeated. Something she'd never show anyone. A beat. Then SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. We've had a pretty good run. She looks up. Sean is in the doorway. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's time to just.. .hang it up. Let it go. Call it a day. Tess's eyes go steely with determination. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You cannot say that to me. I can eat these "sky is falling" dipshits for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, but not YOU. You cannot be that person. I've scoured dirty flea markets for costumes, stayed up all night sewing till my fingers bled, painted and repainted every goddamn wall of this place myself. (MORE)
TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I choreographed every step of every number. I've played nursemaid, sister, mother and shrink to every girl who's ever danced here. I've hocked every keepsake I've ever owned to keep this place afloat. Because this club is the last of it's kind, and if it goes away, one day there won't be anything like it- - and THAT would be a tragedy. So you cannot say that to me. Because now someone's gotta believe in me, Goddamnit. And I need that person to be you. So don't you ever let me hear you say that again. I will never let this club go. Never. Sean looks at her...a wry smile. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is. Thought I'd lost you for a minute. Tess just looks at him, and smiles. He grabs a boa, throw around his neck and exits. When he's gone, Tess's smile fades. IN THE CLUB, the place is empty. Jack is wiping down the cleaning up. He starts stacking some chairs in the house as..SEAN CROSSES the floor. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Jack. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Sean EXITS as Jack carries a stack of chairs to the side the room, sets them down near the piano. STOPS, grabs a c for himself and sits down. Begins to play an original son ACROSS THE ROOM, Ali ENTERS from backstage. Her dance bag over her shoulder. She HEARS the piano, peers around a column, SEES Jack playing. She stays in the shadows and watches as he sings and plays a beautiful song. (TBD) The song ends. Ali applauds slowly. Impressed. Jack looks surprised that she is there. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful. You write that? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some sentimental crap. Ready?
She smiles at his modesty. Nods. He crosses to her. Grabs dance bag and they EXIT together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack enters, unloading his keyboard from his back. He hea Ali in the bedroom. He quietly moves over to the ajar bedroom door -- peeks in and sees: ALI, in bra and undies. She hums the song he played the n before in the mirror as she gets dressed. ON JACK, watching, mesmerized. His eyes travel her body. She moves out of view. He leans against the wall to try t keep seeing her -- and steps on the CAT. It MEOWS. He flattens against the wall. Ali looks up. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack? Jack zips back to the door, opens it quietly, then SLAMS JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Just got home! Ali grabs a dress from her bed, slips into it. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here! Can you zip me up? In a nanosecond-- Jack enters the bedroom. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Where you been? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rehearsing. I'm playing a late show tonight. As he zips up the back of her dress, he sees the PHOTO propped against the lamp on the bedside table. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? She picks up the picture. Looks at it. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my mom on my 7th birthday. She died just a few weeks later.
JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was so young. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24. There was so much she never got to do. Sometimes I feel like, if I make the most of my life, part of her will get to live a little more, too. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You must miss her. She puts the photo down. Turns back to him. They're close ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every single day, something happens I want to tell her about. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was today's? A beat. Their eyes connect. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. Hasn't happened yet. They stand there, close to each other. Jack sees a strand hair caught in the earring. He pulls it away, freeing it. His fingers move through her hair. She closes her eyes, feeling his fingers against her neck. Then she opens her eyes, looks at him. He looks back, una to look away. Until: His CELL PHONE RINGS. Breaking the mood. He pulls it from his pocket. Checks who's calling. Looks back at Ali. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should... it's... Natalie. Ali steps away from him, disappointed. He answers the pho JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, babe, how are you? Ali watches him walk away from her, falling into the conversation with Natalie. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she's still here-What do you want me to do, it's not like you're here helping out, you know...
Ali grabs her bag and jacket, heads for the door. MUSIC UP: An incredibly sexy saxophone which takes us to: FULL CLOSE UP: ALI steps into frame, starts singing. ALI

dialogues.speaker: A GUY WHAT TAKES HIS TIME...
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal she's on stage at the club with the BURLESQUE GIRLS. Finger waves and 1920's sexy clothes. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: THE SONG CONTINUES OVER
dialogues.text: - INT. JACK'S LIVING ROOM - Ali lies on her stomach on th floor perusing a Fashion Magazine. Across the room, Jack on the couch, PLAYING HIS KEYBOARD--UNDERSCORING THE SONG looks at Ali. Watching her. Without looking up, she takes pencil, gathers her hair, and puts it up expertly. A few strands fall back onto her neck. Sexy. Ali feels his star Looks up at him. Smiles. He smiles back. She goes back to magazine. ON JACK. Loving that she's there. - INT. BURLESQUE LOUNGE - DRESSING ROOM - Ali, the Girls Sean getting ready. Georgia bursts into the room, showing an ENGAGEMENT RING. Everyone jumps up, congratulates her. - INT. BURLESQUE STAGE - The GIRLS and Ali vamp, singing: ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: SPOILS A MASTER'S TOUCH ...
dialogues.text: AT THE BAR, Jack watches as he pours drinks. - EXT. STREET. AFTERNOON - Ali on the back of Jack's motorcycle, puts her arms around his waist. Jack revs the engine. Weaving through traffic on the Strip. The wind in their hair. Her scarf tears away, lifting into the air... - INT. BURLESQUE STAGE - Ali and Burlesque girls continue
ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: KNOW A GUY WHAT TAKES HIS TIME ...
dialogues.text: - INT. JACK'S LIVING ROOM - Ali, Sean, Tess, Scarlett, An Georgia, DAMON (her fiance), hanging out in the living ro decorated with party gear. The lights dim and Jack and Co enter with a birthday cake. They set it in front of Ali. Ali looks around at her friends, drinking it in. She lock eyes with Jack -- then closes her eyes and BLOWS. - INT. BURLESQUE STAGE - Ali, still singing her song. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: WHO TAKES HIS TIME...
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal A PACKED HOUSE. The audience goes nut Marcus is at his table, clapping, whistling, her biggest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali walks up to the bar. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- when can you cut out? I'm about to fall asleep standing up. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have that gig, remember? In fact, I gotta head out or I'm gonna be late. (checking his watch) I can maybe swing you home before. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay, you go. I'll grab a ride with Coco. He grabs his jacket from under the bar. As he heads out: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way -- you killed. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him, smiles) Thanks.
He disappears out the back exit. Ali turns around and fin herself face to face with Marcus. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drop you off. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco left five minutes ago. She realizes he was listening to her conversation. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry-- I was coming to talk to you and caught the end of your conversation. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting on her coat reaching for her bags) Talk to me about...? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner. With me. Gimmie that. He swoops down and GRABS her dance bag and purse, turns a heads out. MARCUS (CONT'D) (WALKING AWAY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever expect to see this bag alive again... you'll come with me. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...! Come back here...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Ali, looking out the window with her arms crossed. WID to REVEAL, she's in car with Marcus, zipping along Sunset ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you taking me?
MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you-- to dinner. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner? What about Nikki-- What's up with you and Nikki? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're friends. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I'm from friends don't chew each other's earlobes. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you glad you left? (then, remembering) Oh, damn! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just remembered I have to make a quick appearance at a party. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just remembered. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on the way. We'll be quick. Ten minutes, tops. Do you mind? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I do. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you've been kidnapped. He turns off Sunset and heads up into the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprawling 60's modern. Walls of glass. Jetliner views. Valets running around out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabulous party underway. Packed with glitterati. Music blares, caterers weave through the hip crowd. Marcus lead Ali in and guides her through the crowd.
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Nice house. PARTY GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcus -- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doing? He shakes the guy's hand and moves on through the party. Someone else calls out to him. ANOTHER GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus! MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let me get a drink, I'll be BACK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls Ali in the opposite direction, avoiding anot GROUP trying to greet him. He grabs two wine glasses off tray, gives one to Ali, then pushes through a door into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling, food and booze everywhere. Marcus spots several trays of hors d'oeuvres. He picks up two of them. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus -- you can't just take that. MARCUS SHHH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her one tray, sticks a bottle of wine in one poc throws an opener in another. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna throw us out of here. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if we sneak out first, come on. He kicks open a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sky full of stars, hovering over an expansive back yard Music from the party drifts out. Marcus looks around, up
MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there. He starts up some steps to an outdoor gazebo. Ali follows They pass AN INCREDIBLY WELL-DRESSED COUPLE coming down. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcus -- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Guys. Greg, Marla, this is Ali. They exchange hellos. Ali notices: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. Killer shoes. MARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't they? Louboutins. GREG (TO MARCUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great party, as always. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad you could come. Ali stares at Marcus. He smiles, takes her hand, keeps leading her up the stairs. AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to make an appearance at your own party? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would've been rude not to, right? You'd like those guys. Greg's the entertainment editor at the Times, and Marla's a designer. Ali glances back at Marla again, locks in on her shoes. AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna dream about those shoes. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousand dollars a pop. AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Who can afford that?
MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I saw them first. He laughs as they reach the top of the stairs and a BREATHTAKING PANORAMIC VIEW OF THE ENTIRE CITY is reveale Ali pauses, taking in the glittering, massive view of L.A ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. L.A. looks one hell of a lot prettier from up here. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It should. That view cost me three times what the house did. (POINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that strip mall down there? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own that too? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I own everything above it. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing above it. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own...air? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air rights. The guy who owns the strip mall was having money issues and almost had to sell. Whoever he sold to would have put in a huge tower. So I bought the air rights. Now no one can ever build above one story. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you the sly puss. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mall guy gets to keep his property. I get to keep the second best view in L.A.
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the first? He gazes at her. She rolls her eyes. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many girls have you used that on? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None who ever called me on it. He smiles. Looks at her. Then... MARCUS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Ali? In life. Girl like you, gives up everything, gets on a bus heading for total uncertainty-- she's got a dream. I want to know what it is. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're talented enough to get whatever you want. And I'm smart enough to help make it happen. So? What do you want? A beat. She thinks about it. Looks him in the eye. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be the best singer I can be. I want to give as much joy as I get when I perform. And I want to die knowing I made the most of every opportunity life gave me. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ...so beautiful. AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't a dry eye in the house when I said it at the Grundy County Junior Miss Talent Show. His eyes narrow. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you women always take advantage of nice boys?
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. You are SO not a nice boy. He clinks her glass. Smiles at her. Devilish and sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party's over. Lights low. Ali walks through the almost- empty house, passes a COUPLE making out on a couch, a GUY holds out a joint. She motions "no thanks", heads into th LIVING ROOM, where Marcus is asleep on a Bertolli chair, drink in hand. An OLDER GUY is playing the piano quietly. Ali takes the drink from Marcus's hand, sets it on the ta She hears the pianist start a new song: (TBD). She smiles Goes over to him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, I love this song. The Piano Player scoots to make room. She sits beside him starts humming along. She does too. Then he sings a line. She sings one back. And they fall in together. Not vampin not performing. Just feeling the beauty of the music in t middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack quietly lets himself in. He sets his keyboard down, sees the bedroom door cracked, the light on. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali? He looks in. Empty. He checks the clock: 4:45. He hears a "meow", and sees the cat. He picks it up, turns out the light, and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, Coco, Nikki, Jesse, and the rest of the girls in ea stages of getting ready. Ali enters. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone has a package! Ali sees A GIFT BOX at her station. She reads the card: " saw them first." She opens the box and sees the Louboutin
JESSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. Faboo. Nikki picks one up -- checking their authenticity. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the sucker? All eyes turn to Ali. She's saved by Tess entering. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coco-puff, shake a leg, you're on in five, Georgie-Girl, Ali-Cat -- move, move, move -- Tess exits. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh. My Nanna used to call me her Ali-Cat. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet another fascinating story. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't Tess have a nickname for me? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, she does. A knowing look amongst the girls. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never uses it. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she does. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after you leave the room. Nikki gives him the finger and walks out. A beat. Then: GIRLS TOGETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coke-whore. They crack up. CUE MUSIC: "STRANGE THINGS HAPPENING"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and the Burlesque Girls vamp forward and perform "STR THINGS HAPPENING", a decadent, rockin' dance/singing numb Scantily-clad girls pose and dance on chairs with images projected onto them -- a rock fantasy with burlesque move (like Bob Fosse's "All That Jazz") ALI

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC CONTINUES OVER
dialogues.text: - INT. JACK'S APARTMENT - Jack, playing his keyboards. Al comes in, wearing the Louboutins. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were out late last night. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a ride home with that guy-- Marcus-- we went to a party. It was fun. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus the Asshole? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Turns out he's not so bad. She heads past him, toward the kitchen. He notices: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New shoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, singing. Marcus in the audience, watching her. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali performing. Marcus watching from his table. With him GREG (from the party). Jack watches from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: OOH EVERY DAY ...
dialogues.text: All the Bartenders sing, except Jack, who keeps his eyes Marcus. BARTENDERS

dialogues.speaker: EVERY DAY
dialogues.text: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali getting dressed to go out. She's wearing the Loubouti crossing back and forth in front of Jack, who's on the so JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one reason a man buys a woman shoes, you know. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if I'm getting a little male attention. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get a lot more than a little. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from anyone who matters. JACK (CLEARLY IRRITATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think that you should be careful. Ali stops in front of him. Hands on her hips. AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I just think that -- if you really feel the need to tell a girl what she should and shouldn't do, you should pick up the phone and call your fiancee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali continues to sing. ALI (CONT'D)
AT THEIR TABLE, Greg leans into Marcus and whispers something, impressed. Marcus nods back: "Told you." ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drives Ali up the windy roads, into the hills. They're talking animatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack staring at a note: "Jack: going out, see you tom'w.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali moves in sync with the Girls. Tess watches from the wings, pleased. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: DAY, OOH EVERY DAY
dialogues.text: BARTENDERS

dialogues.speaker: EVERY DAY
dialogues.text: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus leads Ali through a party, introducing her to everyone, making sure she knows people and is known by th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikki watches from the wings, seething, as Marcus delight Ali's performance.
ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wee hours. Ali comes in, shuts the door as quietly as she can, then tiptoes past Jack, asleep on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: YOU...
dialogues.text: After she passes... Jack's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, owning the stage and the room. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ARE HAPPENING
dialogues.text: The SONG ENDS in a flourish. There's a CAMERA FLASH! FREEZE FRAME on the image: ALI, belting onstage, with the Burlesque Girls striking a pose behind her. WIDEN to see it's a photo on the front page of the L.A. T Calendar section. The headline: "BURLESQUE HAS A VOICE:".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, sleepy, in boxers, stares at the newspaper, bewilde JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Have you seen this? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Ali wanders out of the bathroom, brushing her teeth. He shows her the paper. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burlesque Girls (minus Ali) crowd around the paper. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.
SCARLETT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's major. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to photo) Look again. The only thing major is the size of your ass. Nikki walks off-- Scarlett pick up the paper, looks close Ali enters, dance bag over her shoulder, running late. Th Burlesque Girls and Sean all APPLAUD (except Nikki) Ali smiles. Embarrassed. She curtsies sarcastically. Coco points to a BOUQUET OF ROSES at Ali's station. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Monsieur Louboutin, I presume. Ali reads the card: "To the best view in L.A. - M". Sean shoves her down in her seat, pulls her coat off. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake your tail, Alicat, you still got a show to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PACKED LINE of chattering hipsters snakes down the bloc

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC UP
dialogues.text: MUSIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daredevils Missy and Kitten DeVille, in striped stockings corsets, and tons of cleavage, swing on a trapeze over th audience. Playing the comedy, grabbing each other in all right places. Classic Burlesque, unusually bawdy. Equally suggestive, funny, and skillful. Tess, all dolled-up, weaves through the tables, greeting, welcoming, reveling in the crowd. FIND Ali as she strides over to Marcus's booth. He stands hands her a glass of champagne. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the girl of the hour.
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to think you'll go to any length. MARCUS (INNOCENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just made a call to Greg at the Times. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well-- I appreciate the kudos. (re: crowded room) And Tess appreciates the business. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has NOTHING to do with Tess. This is about you. And me. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so full of it. He laughs-- takes her arm-- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got another friend I want you to meet. She sees HAROLD SAINT sitting in the booth. He's in his 60's, still dressing like Robert Evans in his heyday. MARCUS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali Rose, Harold Saint. ALI (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold Saint? Shut up. You worked with Etta James. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her, she chewed me up and spat me out, that one. But with her voice, I forgive her everything. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a set of pipes on you, too, little girl. I like your sound. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like yours. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever recorded?
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. HAROLD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should do something about that. He stands. Turns to Marcus. HAROLD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you round, kiddo. He points his finger, gun-style, which would seem cheesy, he's old school, so instead it's weirdly cool. He leaves. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Harold Saint. AT THE BAR, Jack watches Ali and Marcus talking excitedly Not liking what he sees. Sean breezes by, grabs a drink. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You snooze, you lose, pretty boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean grips the drink in his teeth as he bustles through t backstage, gathering costumes. He passes Tess going the o way. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe this crowd? He dumps the costumes in her arms. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'bout time. These poor babies are begging for your glue-gun. Tess walks off with the armful of clothes, so happy, humm to herself, passes her OFFICE-- OPENS the door to SEE-- VINCE is sitting at her desk. He flinches at the sight of TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe the crowd out there? Never thought I'd see- She stops in her tracks, spotting Vince's PANTS on the FL and a TRAIL OF WOMEN'S CLOTHES to... THE NEW COCKTAIL WAITRESS, peering out, half-dressed, fro behind the curtains--
TESS (CONT'D) (DISGUSTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my god damn office? She shakes her head-- GRABS HER PURSE-- and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess, pissed off, carries the damaged costumes out to her car. Nikki is behind her, following her out. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess. We need to talk. Tess rolls her eyes, doesn't slow. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Nikki. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, now. I've been here since the beginning. We built this club together. And then some girl shows up out of nowhere-- who hasn't even paid her dues-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get her to write a check tomorrow. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly it's her show? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not her show. It's my show. But people want to hear her sing. She's bringing them in off the streets. You better believe I'm building a show around her! NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can sing too! And you know it. But you don't give a shit. You always say this is a dance troupe, now suddenly it's not? TESS NIKKI--
NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you expect me to dance behind a girl who struts in with a new pair of shoes she got for sleeping with Marcus Gerber? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unlocking her car) Nikki, you're wasted. Go home. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be upstaged by some slut with mutant lungs! Tess hurls the costumes in the trunk of her car, furious. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don't be! Leave! If you don't want to be a part of what's happening here, then I don't want you around. NIKKI (AGHASST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd destroy our friendship and break up the group over some girl you barely know? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you care about friendship? Or this group? You're a trainwreck, Nikki! You put tequila on your breakfast cereal! I'm struggling to survive here, and you show up too drunk to dance! You call that loyalty? Nikki just looks at her-- NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. I quit! Nikki stomps off. Tess sighs -- TESS NIKKI-- WAIT-- NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus says you're losing the club anyway! (MOCKING HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "They don't come to hear us sing" (MORE)
NIKKI (CONT'D) (SOTTO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid bitch. Nikki flips her off and keeps walking. Then turns once mo NIKKI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way: I slept with Vince the day after your honeymoon. Tess's eyes narrow. She grabs a HIGH-HEELED PUMP and HURL it. It flies through the air and hits Nikki in the back o the head. Nikki SCREAMS, whips around, incredulous, to se TESS, running right at her. Nikki bolts, heading for her car. She jumps in, locks the door just as Tess SMASHES he fist on the window and KICKS the door. Nikki starts the c NIKKI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy bitch! Nikki screeches off, leaving Tess alone in the parking lo Tess stands there a moment, then HEADS back into the club

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The club is totally empty. Everyone is gone. Tess ENTERS, GRABS her bag as she spots a cabaret chair lying on it's on stage. She crosses onto the stage. Picks up the chair as...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Night, Tess. Tess looks up, Dave is closing up the sound booth. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Dave. Dave FLIPS a big lever, and almost all the lights go OUT, leaving one shaft of light across the stage. We HEAR Dave leave, as the street door closes shut. Tess alone on stag BEGIN TESS SOLO SONG NUMBER. TO BE WRITTEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters quietly, all dressed up. She slips off her hee and tiptoes to the bedroom. She slowly opens the bedroom door, then stops when she sees:

JACK, asleep in the bed. Ali looks at him, then looks at couch. Empty. She closes the door, fluffs the pillow, lie down on the couch, and pulls the blankets up over her. She lies in the darkness. PUSH THROUGH the wall to see Ja lying awake in the bed, the cat on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Ali, sleeping on the sofa-- abruptly wakes to th deafening grinding of coffee. She gets up, drags herself the kitchen. Sees Jack, grinding the coffee way longer th is necessary. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really need to do that at 6 in the morning? He turns, sees her. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little overdressed for breakfast. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pajamas were in my bedroom. Which was occupied. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're never here so... it's stupid for me to crash on the couch every night when there's a perfectly good empty bed. Jack grinds the coffee beans again. Ali winces. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- you want the bedroom back? Is that what you're saying? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed should be used by someone. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm home every night. Maybe not when you think I should be, but last I checked, you were my roommate, not my mother. (MORE)     99 ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, since it's an issue, what the hell, take the bed, I'll sleep on the sofa. I don't care. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to move all your shit. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause the room's a total mess -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll move my stuff, God -- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes, make-up, shoes, hair things. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jack, what is your problem? Ever since I started hanging out with Marcus, you've been acting like a class-A prick. Is there something you want to say? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. What do I care? You're ambitious, he can make things happen, go ahead, make a deal with the devil, what's it to me? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all: He's not the devil. He's a smart businessman. And oddly enough-- a gentleman. (JACK SCOFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second: I'm gonna take the couch, and you're gonna 86 the attitude. Or I'm finding another place to live. She storms out of the kitchen, tripping over the cat-- a MEOW! as the cat scurries away, Jack intercepting him-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And try not to kill the cat!
A SLAM of the bedroom door. MUSIC UP: INSTRUMENTAL to "BA IT'S YOUR by The Shirelles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A DIAMOND RING as it's placed on the hand of A VERY PREGNANT GEORGIA. Wearing an adorable mini-skirt maternity wedding dress. She looks at DAMON with devotion Ali, Tess, Coco, Sean and Jack, all watching the ceremony Ali looks over at Jack. He looks at her, then away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception is underway. GUESTS are drinking, dancing w the iconic backdrop of Hollywood behind them. Ali, Sean, Coco and Tess stand together drinking, overlooking the ci ACROSS THE TERRACE, Jack is talking on his cell phone. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you're still in New York? ...So you just -- decided not to come? You think you might've wanted to, I don't know, let me know??? We haven't seen each other in six months. ACROSS THE TERRACE, Ali sees Jack yelling into his phone. Sean sees her watching.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON JACK
dialogues.text: JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .why does every conversation we have end up being about YOUR future... Jack looks across the terrace at Ali. Moonlight on her shoulders. A breeze in her hair. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .you know what, you're right. We both should be thinking about our futures. And I might just be looking at mine right now. Break a leg baby. Jack hangs up with finality and marches toward the bar-- cell phone immediately rings again.     101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees it's Natalie, sends it to voicemail, and shuts of his phone. As he PASSES Sean and Coco-- JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Natalie's not coming after all. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, that girl? Show up at a party where she's not the center of attention? AT THE BAR - LATER - Jack drains one drink and orders another, getting very drunk. Ali sidles up to the bar. ALI (TO BARTENDER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of Patron. Jack raises his brow. Ali drinks the shot, and without looking at him-- ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' kinda lonely. JACK (BOOZEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not lonely. Liberated, yes. Libated, absolutely. But never lonely. Cheers, baby-- He raises his glass-- she rolls her eyes, walks off-- he follows her, playfully PUSHING her from behind. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-- what're we, in junior high? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still mad at me, Iowa? C'mon. Bring it on. She starts to say something as-- THE SHIRELLES start to s "BABY IT'S YOU"-- Jack turns to the DJ, points both finge at him and YELLS: JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE THIS SONG, MAN
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at the drunk guy. Ali rolls her eyes and walks off-- Jack swings her around, PULLING her close-- s just looks at him. Starts to laugh at how drunk he is-- J wraps her in his arms and starts to sing quietly in her e
JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Many many many nights go by, I sit alone, at home and cry, over you... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're quite the crooner. He looks her in the eye. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for being a class A prick. Ali smiles, surprised at his candor. He breathes a sigh o relief. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as of about... (bleary look at his watch, CAN'T FOCUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .some time ago, I am officially a single man. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Natalie split up? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we did. So. That explains what I'm doing here all alone. What are you doing here all alone? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look alone to you? They share a look. Then he spins her around in his arms. laughs. AT THE BAR, tipsy Sean and Coco stand side-by-side. Coco watching the DJ spin. The DJ glances down at them. COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That DJ's hot. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think? COCO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps looking at me. Coco smiles up at him, flirty. The DJ smiles back.
COCO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm...I think he's cuckoo for Coco- puffs. They look at each other, then crack up like giggling schoolgirls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A KEY TRYING TO GO INTO A LOCK. Then it disappe from view. We hear it CLANK to the ground. Then giggles.

dialogues.speaker: ALI, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Whoopsie daisy -- PULL BACK to find Jack and Ali, drunk, staring at the key the ground. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoopsie daisy? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Nanna used to say that all the time. That and upsie jumpsie. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upsie jumpsie? (running it together) Upsie jumpsie, whoopsie daisy, upsie jumpsie, whoopsie daisy, upsie jumpsie -- (ABRUPTLY STOPS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When would she say that? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she wanted her dog to get on the bed with her. That is -- (DRUNKEN WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: when she was alive. Their eyes meet. A connection. Then, staring into her eye JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be serious) The dog, or Nanna? Ali bursts out laughing. So does Jack, as he pushes the d open, and they fall into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Ali stumble in, Jack knocks the lamp over trying turn on the light. It BREAKS. Ali giggles as she plops do on the couch, struggling to take off her leather boot. No luck. She holds her legs out. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me. Jack gets the lamp to standing, then grabs one of Ali's boots, slides it off, dumps it. Then he tries the second it sticks -- he pulls harder -- the boot pops off and he careens backwards, crashing into the lamp, knocking it ov again. Ali cracks up. He turns to the lamp. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like to a dog) Stay. He turns back to Ali, regains composure, bows JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. He backs away, into the bedroom. Ali looks confused. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Jack disappears into the bedroom and closes the door. Ali stares at it, surprised. Then resigned. Oh, well. She undoes her bra, threads it through her top and out the ar Then Jack's door opens. He stands in the doorway in match "Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer" pajamas, leaning against doorframe like Hugh Hefner in his finest silk smoking jac ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute jammies. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gift from my mother. Never worn them. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go figure. Jack walks past Ali, toward the door.
JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot to lock up. (HE DOES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Night. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night again. He walks back into the bedroom and once gain shuts the do Ali smiles to herself, plumps her pillow. The door flies open again -- Jack's there in just the pants, no top. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water. No hangover. He stumbles past Ali to the kitchen, drinks from the tap. After a moment he returns to the bedroom, nodding to Ali. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. Ali just nods. He closes the door. Ali smiles, waiting. After a beat, the door opens again. Jack is there, in box JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry. He walks past her to the kitchen, opens a box of cereal, pours it into his mouth. Grabs some milk from the fridge, pours it into his mouth, too. Returns to the bedroom, crunching. He closes the door. Then -- very quickly -- he opens it again and walks out. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I forgot something else, but I just can't remember what... (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door locked, water, food... He wanders out into the room, past Ali, and we see from behind he is butt-ass naked. She cracks up. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny? She covers her face. He glances down. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I never! He strides back to the bedroom, shutting the door. After moment, he comes back out dressed in an old, flowered bathrobe and fur-lined orange hunting cap.
JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remembered what I forgot to do. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JACK (SERIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss you goodnight. He crosses to her, takes her in his arms, and kisses her. She kisses back, making up for all their lost time. MUSIC UP: "PRISONER" a big, soulful ballad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali steps into frame on stage, singing: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN TO:

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Jack and Ali in bed, in post-coital bliss. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's official. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are definitely not gay. He smiles at her, drunk with lust. CAMERA PANS UP AND OFF

dialogues.speaker: THE CLUB
dialogues.text: Ali on stage, lights blasting.
ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: JACK'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Ali and Jack in bed, in different positions, wrapped in sheets. Jack traces the outline of her lips with his fing JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been wanting to do this since you first walked in the club. She cocks an eyebrow at him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure got a funny way of showing it. He smiles at her. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you an even funnier way -- you ready? He disappears under the sheets. She SQUEALS, starts laugh hysterically. CAMERA PANS UP AND OFF OF THEM THEN DRIFTS

dialogues.speaker: BURLESQUE LOUNGE
dialogues.text: Ali, on stage, belting: ALI
Jack in bed, sitting against the headboard, wearing only hat. Ali's leg in the foreground, a la The Graduate, as s pulls on one fishnet stocking. Jack watches, mesmerized. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what about Natalie...? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie who? Ali smiles. Rolls the stocking up over her shapely thigh, then slowly takes it off. Looks at Jack. He strikes his chest, struck by cupid-- JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it again. She giggles, repeats the sexy act for him. CAMERA PANS UP

dialogues.speaker: THE BURLESQUE LOUNGE
dialogues.text: Ali on stage, the big finish: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack and Ali, twisted up in the sheets, their respective eyeliners smeared. Ali's platinum bob sticks up in all directions. Half of a fake eyelash stuck on her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE LOCK as a key is inserted. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF WOMEN'S HEELS enter the apartment and pick thei way over last night's discarded clothes and head for:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Jack and Ali are sleeping, entwined. The heels stop the base of the bed. A beat. Then, enraged: NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: I KNEW IT
dialogues.text: Jack bolts up in bed. Stares. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie! Ali blinks awake. Confused. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie? Jack scrambles for something to put on. NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU are a LIAR. You're a sneaky, pathetic LI-AR! ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet, to Jack) What 's she doing here: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I LIVE HERE, you bleached out tramp, what the hell are YOU doing here?!! ALI (TO JACK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were engaged to this woman? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finds his boxers) Nat, can we talk about this in the living room --
NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't BELIEVE I bought your bullshit: "It's nothing, she's just this chick from work, she's nothing." (TO ALI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he called you. "Nothing. She's not even pretty. (sizing Ali up) Well, at least you were honest about one thing-- ALI JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that? No, I didn't --

dialogues.speaker: NATALIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He most certainly did! Nat-- shut the fu-- ALI NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack?!? Don't even say his name! As Ali grabs for a shirt-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Ali-- let me just-- would you mind -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving us a little privacy? AL I (OFFENDED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to leave? NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you! I'm the fiancee. You're a booty call. You go. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, Jesus, STOP IT! Ali grabs some pants from the floor, pulls them on. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'm out of here-- (seething to Jack) You said you split up!     NATALIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one phone call? Please, you don't dump a girl like me on the phone. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you-- STOP IT! As Ali quickly grabs a few things-- JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali-- I'm really sorry-- I-- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I. She gathers up more things, really pissed-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- do you need money for a Motel or... Ali stifles him with an incredulous glare-- can't believe this is going down. She looks at him, so incredibly hurt. Grabs her suitcase and brushes past him, stuffing her belongings into it. Jack goes after her-- JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, wait a second-- don't-- (as the door SLAMS) --go. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. Jack looks at Natalie. She folds her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali knocks on a door, suitcase in hand. A beat. Then a go looking guy, who's obviously just woken up, answers with blanket wrapped around him. He is the DJ from the wedding ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'm sorry. I think I have the wrong apartment. I'm looking for Sean? (off his blank look) Brown hair? 5'10n? Early 30's? DJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sean! I thought he said John. He's asleep. Come in.
The DJ shuffles inside. Ali follows as he leads her to th bedroom. He points to Sean in the bed. DJ (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That him? Ali nods. Sean's eyes pop open, confused to see her. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story. Sean notices the guy in the blanket. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, this is Mike. DJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark??? (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Anyone want coffee? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it. You two get acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali makes coffee, looking out the window at Hollywood. He phone rings. She answers right away, thinking it's Jack. ALI HEY--

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hey gorgeous. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Marcus. MARK (WANDERING IN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the coffee ready?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Who's that?
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. Or Mike. Jury's still out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Should I be jealous? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you had your eye on Sean.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: You okay? You sound down. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Maybe a little.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: I know just the cure. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (OVER PHONE)
dialogues.text: Me. But you turned me down. She thinks for a moment. Then: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you heard? No is the new yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A curtain lifts revealing a black box, FIVE GIRLS from be seem to be floating in blackness, their curves illuminate They begin to move to the music (think WABASH BLUES, CRAZ HORSE SALOON) The group turns toward us-- ALI

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SLAMMING DOOR.
dialogues.text: NATALIE'S HEELS storm away from the apartment. Carrying h bags, really PISSED, she kicks a big, fat rose blossom of bush, and continues on.
The girls continue the number. Post modern Gaultier bonda cages on top, bowler hats and black shorts. A HUMONGOUS m hangs at the back of the theatre, the black stage awash i golden light. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is waiting in his Bentley. Ali gets in. Marcus loo at her. She forces a smile. The Bentley rounds the corner we HOLD and see JACK'S MOTORCYCLE thunder up. He gets off runs to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Mark exchange awkward good-byes. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Bye. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... Take care. Sean. Mark turns, heads down the stairs as Jack rushes up, call JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Ali here? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just left. Mark continues down. Jack whips around, looks at him, the at Sean, who nods. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd she go? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Marcus. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?
SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, opportunity doesn't knock forever. Jack burns, frustrated, then heads slowly down the stairs Sean shakes his head and turns to go back inside. Then pauses, noticing: Mark, looking up at Sean's apartment, hesitating. Then he opens his car to get in. Sean stands there, realizing he' doing the same thing. He steps onto the stairwell. Calls SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You! MARK (LOOKS UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mark. SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark. You wanna have breakfast? Off Mark's smile:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali follows Marcus through the kitchen, to the fridge. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother always said there's only one thing to do when you're feeling blue... He opens the fridge and pulls out a bottle of CHAMPAGNE. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was a poet. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a drunk. Ali smiles. Marcus pops the cork, fills two glasses, hand her one. Clinks. MARCUS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To your new place. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What new place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lavish, 1000-square-foot guest house. Marcus ushers Ali MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All yours. (off her look) Unpack. Move in. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, I can't just-- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you can. Marcus plops her suitcase on the bed. MARCUS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unpack. You're home. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not even on the bus route. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that is the first and last time the term "bus route" will be spoken in this house. (motions out window) Four cars. Which do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali lies on a chaise overlooking the panoramic view of L. against a fiery red sky. Marcus comes out of the house, w a bottle of wine. Crosses and sits next to her on the cha Marcus refills their wine glasses. An empty bottle alread there. She sips as she leans back and relaxes. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better? ALI (SMILES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. She looks out at a giant billboard at eye level. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be on one of those someday.
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooner than you think, too. Harold Saint called me today. You made quite an impression on him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What'd he say? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to make a demo with you. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? When?? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He found a little studio time on Tuesday. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Tuesday? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too soon? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Oh my god, no, that's amazing. You're amazing. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like making you happy. Your whole face lights up. Their eyes meet. He pushes some hair out of her face. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're way too nice to me. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's a problem because... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had a lot to drink. And my judgment is off. He touches her face, their chemistry palpable. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a gentleman. Which means I'd never kiss a lady when she's... vulnerable.
She looks at him. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar. She leans in and impulsively pulls him into a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack, alone now, collects the clothes Ali left behind. He reaches under the couch and sees the PHOTO of Ali and her mother. He picks it up, smooths out the cracks. Traces 7- year-old Ali's face with his fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali lies in a tangle of 1000-thread-count sheets. Her eye blink open. She sits up alone, getting her bearings. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I? She sees a Warhol-esque PRINT OF MARCUS on the wall. She raises her brows then sees her disheveled reflection in a huge mirror: smeared mascara, hair askew. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I? She sees her and Marcus's clothes in a trail on the floor bites her lip, remembering last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, freshly showered, enters, a stranger in a strange la STAFF is milling around. She HEARS a SPLASH. Looks out th glass windows, sees Marcus swimming laps. The HOUSEKEEPER passes her, nods "morning". Ali smiles. Then she notices a long table full of miniature MODELS of BUILDINGS. She takes them in, pausing at a tall, sleek MO of a glass HIGH-RISE, towering over the other models. She runs her finger lightly over it, intrigued. Then she sees the address marker: 7800 Sunset Blvd. Ali stares, stunned. Marcus enters, toweling himself dry. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.
He comes up behind her, nuzzles her neck. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's a model. But when it grows up, it'll be a mixed-use space: retail and residential. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the address of the Burlesque Lounge. Marcus shrugs, dries his hair. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best view on the Sunset Strip, with no windows. When I'm done with it, it'll have a thousand. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tear down the club. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I can. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the history? That place is a landmark. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not according to the city. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Tess know about this? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Tess knows and doesn't know isn't a big concern of mine. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think she would ever sell the Lounge? MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has no choice. She's going under. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that club is her life!
MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, you get this. It's business. It's not personal. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not personal? It's pretty god damn personal for Tess! And Coco and Sean and Alexis. And what about Jesse? And Dave the lighting guy? MARCUS ALI -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about me? It's pretty God damn personal to me. She turns to leave. MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the club. Where I work. She marches out of the room, resolute-- MARCUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali-- wait!!! At the door she turns back and looks at him. As he starts speak, she SLAMS the door shut as we HEAR "THAT'S LIFE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eva Destruction does a sexy contortionist number on stage the Tattooed Bumper Band plays "THAT'S LIFE" with her. CLOSE ON - a LINE OF SHOT GLASSES. Tequila is poured. The Bartenders behind the bar, Jack sits on a stool on the ot side, his bags packed beside him. They all pick up their glasses, toast and drink as they begin to sing "THAT'S LI in a rousing, fun, guys number.
