dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess pulls into the lot-- gets out of her car dressed to nines in a tailored business suit, hair up, professional. HEADS into the club--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eva performs and the Bartenders and Jack sing, SEAN lo up at Dave, and MOTIONS for the SPOTLIGHT on Jack. Dave n and SWINGS the SPOTLIGHT hitting JACK. The Bartenders pus Jack up onto the bar as he TAKES THE LEAD-- JACK

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RACE...
dialogues.text: The whole club is with him now, as Jack channels Sinatra, standing on the bar-- the Bartenders sing back-up. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BALL AND DIE. MY, MY.
dialogues.text: Applause, hoots and hollers. Jack high-fives and fist pum his buddies, hugs Sean, grabs his bag and suitcase and EX out the back as... Tess ENTERS. SEES Sean is at the bar. He looks up-- SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go? (sees her face) Oh, shit.
She grabs a bottle of Tequila and a glass, turns to walk SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now? Get really drunk. THE FRONT DOORS OPEN, and Ali ENTERS, spots Tess, rushes to her. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess! I have to talk to you! Tess keeps walking. ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus Gerber is trying to buy the lounge, and he's gonna tear it down and build a twenty-story skyscraper! Tess stops. Slowly turns and stares at Ali, who's suddenl embarrassed to admit... ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just saw the plans. Tess looks at Ali. Stunned. Ali stands there, breathless, waiting for her reaction. But Tess just turns, continues to her office, and shuts the door. Ali turns to Sean-- th starts after her-- ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to do something! She can't just let him -- SEAN (STOPPING HER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, girl. She just got turned down for another loan. It's either foreclose, or sell to Marcus. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it? It's over? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circle of life, baby. All good things must come to an end. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she can't just give up!
SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not giving up. She's going down with her ship. With dignity. Ali sits on a barstool, in disbelief. SEAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something for you. He pulls out the photo of Ali with her mother. It's in a frame. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. He dropped it off on his way to the airport. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he going? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York on the red-eye. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be with Natalie? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pedal faster, baby, he and Natalie are over. You're the one he's been looking high and low for. ALI (TOUCHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really...? (THEN:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why's he going to New York? SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (duh!) Get your ass over to LAX and ask him yourself! Ali nods, jumps up from her stool, and races for the door then stops, realizing: ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a -- Sean tosses her his CAR KEYS.
SEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American to JFK. Go! Ali catches the keys and TAKES OFF. - EXT. PARKING LOT - NIGHT - Ali (in a Prius) peels out o the lot, weaving through traffic as she lifts her cell. - INT. AIRPORT - NIGHT - CLOSE SHOT: a CELL PHONE in a plastic bowl moves through a security X-ray machine. JACK'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jack. Leave me a message. FIND Jack on the other side, as his belongings come down conveyor belt. He grabs them, turns off his cell. - EXT. STREET - NIGHT - ALI skids through a light, veers cars. - INT. CONCOURSE - NIGHT Jack reaches gate 43, sees a lon line. Gets in back. - INT. AIRPORT TERMINAL - NIGHT - Ali bolts through the front door, frantically checks the DEPARTURES MONITOR. Finds: NEW YORK JFK, GATE 43: NOW BOARDING. - INT. TERMINAL - NIGHT - Ali races up the escalator, approaching SECURITY. SECURITY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boarding pass? AL I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to someone, he's -- SECURITY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's allowed past this point without a boarding pass. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to speak to him! SECURITY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, miss. ALI

dialogues.speaker: I HAVE TO GET TO GATE 43
dialogues.text: SECURITY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Gate 43, right over there.
He points. It's the first gate beyond Security. Ali sees Jack, in line, about to board the plane. He's wearing his iPod headset, deaf to the world. ALI

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: ALL HEADS TURN to look at her, except Jack, who can't hea A PLUMP WOMAN in front of him looks at Ali. Ali points to Jack. The woman taps Jack and points. He looks to see: ALI, on the other side of Security. Jack takes his earpho off and smiles. He crosses over to her, carrying his bag. They are separated by several feet of security ropes. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean told me you're going to New York. Please don't go! JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to. I got an offer from that band -- the Punk Fusion group. They want me to tour with them. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They finally had it with the flaky keyboardist. I'll be back in five weeks. Will you be here? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes. Absolutely. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Marcus? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Marcus who? They share a smile, separated by the ropes. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to figure out if I should kiss you now, or make you wait five weeks. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five weeks?! That's forever!
ANGLE ON: A MALE AND FEMALE SECURITY GUARD, listening to whole exchange.

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK, JFK AT GATE 43
dialogues.text: JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go, that's me. He picks up his bags. It's killing Ali. JACK (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you when I get there. Take care of Miles Davis. (off Ali's confusion) Our cat. I named him. They smile again. Neither wanting this moment to end. She waves. He nods. Then he turns and walks off to board. Ali watches him go. ON JACK, walking back to the gate-then -- he stops. Turns back to see Ali, but she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Boy, you get out there and kiss that girl! Now! Jack looks at her, then quickly turns to walk past the Ma Security Guard.

dialogues.speaker: MALE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Go ahead-- but you're gonna have to come back through Security again. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then I'll miss my flight!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Martin! Don't you dare keep that boy from kissing his girl! Martin looks at Jack. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MALE SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Ah, hell. Go ahead. Bag stays here. Jack drops his bag, takes a running JUMP over the ROPES a RUNS through the crowded concourse -- startling everyone. ON ALI, as she walks through the concourse, reliving her sight of Jack. As she's about to get on the escalator:
JACK

dialogues.speaker: ALI
dialogues.text: She turns. Jack is there. In one fantastically romantic m he pulls her into his arms, kisses her deeply -- an epic that makes passersby stop and stare.

dialogues.speaker: TO NEW YORK JFK AT GATE 43.
dialogues.text: Jack looks at Ali. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go get 'em, Jack. He smiles, then disappears into the crowd. Ali stands the watching him, gobsmacked by the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean's car whips into the parking lot. Ali jumps out and heads for the front entrance. The CONSTRUCTION WORKERS fr the towering building across the street HOOT and CAT-CALL her. She waves to them and nods: that's right, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali enters just as Tess, in a spotlight on stage, turns toward the audience. She looks fabulous. Only someone who knows her really well could tell she's dying inside. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoother than honey and twice as sweet. Each girl lovelier then the next. Gentlemen, hold onto your hats. Ladies, hold on to your gentlemen. We may not have windows.. .but we DO have... (motions to the girls) .the best view on the Sunset Strip. The audience hoots as the Burlesque Girls ENTER the stage dancing. (SONG TBD) ON ALI-- a lightbulb going on! As Tess exits the stage, A pushes through the crowd and races backstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess is arriving in her office, defeated, as Ali bursts i behind her. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tess! TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could knock-- this is still my office--at least for another 48 HOURS-- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is really, really -- Tess holds up a hand. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not. Now. ALI BUT-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said -- NOT -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes now! God damn, you are one stubborn mule of a woman. Anyone else in their right mind would have figured out by now, when I have something to tell you, you listen! I told you I could dance, did you listen? No. Big mistake. I told you I could sing, did you listen? No. Big. mistake. This time you are going to hear what I have to say if I have to tie you up with your corset strings and scream it in your God damn ear. For the first time someone silences Tess. Ali takes a bre ALI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard of air rights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SETS OF FIERCE HEELS and LEGS stride in unison down a sidewalk. PAN UP as Tess and Ali enter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smartly-dressed BUSINESSMAN sits at his mahogany desk d in a phone conversation as WHAM! The door to his office flies open and Ali and Tess stride in, an overwrought assistant on their heels. BUSINESSMAN (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim -- Jim -- hang on, I'm gonna have to call you back -- Jim! Damnit, Nancy, get him back. Assistant scurries out. Businessman turns to Tess. BUSINESSMAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with more noise complaints? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You offered to buy my club a few years back. I said no. BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you've changed your mind. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. Tess smiles at him. Looks at Ali, who's not smiling. She elbows her. Ali starts smiling. Tess walks up to the desk sits herself down. Ali does the same. BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with me, there's a good ending, I promise. How much will these condos you're building sell for? BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start at one million and go up, depending on the view. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I told you a twenty-story high-rise was going up where my club is? (TO ALI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would twenty stories block his view?
ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten stories would. Twenty would decimate them. Leaving behind a lot of angry homeowners staring across the street at fluorescent light bulbs and dirty windows. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. Mr. ? BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Anderson. Your pretty million- dollar ocean views are going away because I'm selling my building to a developer tomorrow who'll have his twenty stories all framed up by the time you start selling -- ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to sell-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to sell these condos. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or. I can put you in a position where your buyers could be guaranteed their million-dollar views forever. BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As am I. As long as you're telling me you'll have a check to me by 5:00 today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BUMPER BAND PLAYS. Vince sits with his POSSE. His cocktail waitress/girlfriend approaches with an empty tra She whispers to him: COCKTAIL WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, baby, they cut you off at the bar. Said you have to pay cash. VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I co-own this goddamn place--
Tess comes up behind him. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore you don't. I'm buying you out. VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, according to page 4 of our contract, I can. VINCE (SCOFFING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next 48 hours? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why postpone joy? She hands him a CASHIER'S CHECK. Vince stares at it. VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is this? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize it's been a while since you've seen one, but it's called a check. He stares at it, stunned.Then at her. VINCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your business anymore. And neither is the lounge. (POINTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you know where the door is. It used to be half yours. (re. the waitress) And take HER with you. Tess turns and goes over to the bar, where Ali spins arou on her barstool, having heard the whole thing. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd that feel? TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not half bad.

Tess parks it next to her. Looks at Ali. Smiles, then bre into a giggle. Ali smiles. Tess laughs even harder, tears her eyes now. They are just two girls laughing hysterical at the bar, Tess keeps trying to say something, but can't it out, until she looks Ali square in the eye... TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It felt pretty God damn awesome! And they crack up again. Then... ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to think, you didn't even want me around. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, here it comes. ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .What was it you said to me that first night? "Twenty bucks at the door will make all your dreams come true." That was sweet of you. TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you finished? ALI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loving needling her) Kinda ironic, when you think about it. I started off begging you to make my dreams come true, and here we are -- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right already! You want me to say it, I'll say it. She looks at her. TESS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is the love of my life. The only dream I've ever had. I don't know what I would have done if I had lost it. (HEARTFELT NOW)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. A moment between them... as Tess SPOTS NIKKI ENTER the cl carrying her dance bag--a little fresher than we've seen before, and sober. Nikki looks over at Tess... then approaches. Ali turns away on her bar stool, respectfully
NIKKI (SHEEPISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I crossed the line. Tess crosses her arms, and with a smirk on her face-- TESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, and I wanna come home-- TESS AGAIN-- NIKKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, again! Did you fill my spot or what...? TESS

This song (to be writ is a contemporary dance song about BURLESQUE with a vinta feel to it. Nikki and the Burlesque Girls, in similar costumes, back Ali as she SINGS her big finale.
